member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateSetPredicate
member.summary: Predicate class which performs an aggregate function on a set of entities and returns true or false depending if that aggregated value matches a specified expression. The set of entities this predicate is applied on are the elements of a member property with the name specified which match the specified filter.
member.remarks: Meant for in-memory filtering. Can't be used in database targeting filters.

member.summary: Abstract base implementation of the IPredicate interface.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPredicate
member.summary: Interface for a predicate. Predicates are expressions which result in true or false, and which are used in WHERE clauses. Generic

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPredicate.ToQueryText(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves a ready to use text representation of the contained Predicate.
member.param: int counter which is appended to every parameter. The refcounter is increased by every parameter creation, making sure the parameter is unique in the predicate and also in the predicate expression(s) containing the predicate.
member.returns: The contained Predicate in textual format.
member.exception: When IPredicate.DatabaseSpecificCreator is not set to a valid value.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPredicate.ToQueryText(System.Int32@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a ready to use text representation of the contained Predicate.

if set to true, it will allow aggregate functions to be applied to fields.
member.returns: The contained Predicate in textual format.
member.exception: When IPredicate.DatabaseSpecificCreator is not set to a valid value.

member.summary: The list of parameters created when the Predicate was translated to text usable in a query. Only valid after a succesful call to ToQueryText

Name of the property to set with the instance of the type annotated with this attribute.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DependencyInjectionInfoAttribute.TargetNamespaceFilter
member.summary: Gets / sets the targetNamespaceFilter string which contains semi-colon (;) separated names, or fragments of names of namespaces to limit implementations of TargetType to, when TargetType is an interface. If any fragment specified is found as the start of the type’s namespace name, that type is a valid target. Optional. If no targetnamespacefilter is specified, all types are targeted.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DependencyInjectionInfoAttribute.Property
member.summary: Gets / sets the propertyinfo object for the property to go.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DependencyInjectionInfoAttribute.TargetKind
member.summary: Gets / sets targetKind. Targetkind defines which types get the instance injected: only the specified type (absolute) or also all subtypes (hierarchy, default). If this property is set to a value and TargetType is an interface, TargetKind will be reset to Absolute.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DependencyInjectionInfoAttribute.ContextType
member.summary: Gets / sets contextType. ContextType is the specification of what kind of instance is injected: a shared instance (Singleton) or a new instance each time an injection has to be made (NewInstancePerTarget, default).

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DependencyInjectionInfoAttribute.TargetType
member.summary: Gets / sets targetType, into which to inject an instance of the type annotated with this attribute. Can be an interface, in which case all types which implement the interface and thus with the specified propertyName will get the instance type injected (if applicable)

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DependencyInjectionInfoAttribute.PropertyName
member.summary: Gets / sets propertyName, which is the name of the property to set with the instance of the type annotated with this attribute.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AuditorBase
member.summary: Abstract base class for auditors in the LLBLGen Pro system. Use this class to easily create auditors to perform auditing for you.
member.remarks: If you plan to use binary serialization in your application, be sure to read the recommendations in the manual about serialization and auditor objects.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor
member.summary: Interface for the auditor to be used with entity instances at runtime. Auditors audit at runtime various actions on entities and allow automatic persistence of audit information in audit entities when transactions are committed.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.AuditEntityFieldGet(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore,System.Int32)
member.summary: Audits when an entity field's value is succesfully obtained from the passed in entity
member.param: The entity a field's value was obtained.
Index of the field which value was obtained.
member.remarks: Be careful when using this auditing routine, because a lot of calls will be made to this routine when data is for example shown in a grid. Another thing to realize is that the audit information is stored inside the auditor which is inside an entity which might not be persisted/deleted later on. This means that if you use the audit data to produce entities which are then returned by GetAuditEntitiesToSave are never persisted if the entity this auditor is the auditor of is never persisted/deleted. In that situation, to get reliable journalling, use an external service to log the audit data.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.AuditEntityFieldSet(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Audits when an entity field is set succesfully to a new value.
member.param: The entity a field was set to a new value.
Index of the field which got a new value.
The original value of the field with the index passed in before it received a new value.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.AuditDereferenceOfRelatedEntity(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore,System.String)
member.summary: Audits the successful dereference of related entity from the entity passed in.
member.param: The entity of which the related entity was dereferenced from.
The related entity which was dereferenced from entity
Name of the mapped field onto the relation from entity to related entity for which the related entity was dereferenced.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.AuditReferenceOfRelatedEntity(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore,System.String)
member.summary: Audits the successful reference of related entity from the entity passed in.
member.param: The entity of which the related entity was dereferenced from.
The related entity which was dereferenced from entity
Name of the mapped field onto the relation from entity to related entity for which the related entity was referenced.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.AuditInsertOfNewEntity(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore)
member.summary: Audits the successful insert of a new entity into the database.
member.param: The entity saved successfully into the database.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.AuditUpdateOfExistingEntity(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore)
member.summary: Audits the successful update of an existing entity in the database
member.param: The entity updated successfully in the database.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.AuditDirectUpdateOfEntities(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPredicate,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRelationCollection,System.Int32)
member.summary: Audits the succesful direct update of entities in the database.
member.param: The entity with the changed values which is used to produce the update query.
The filter to filter out the entities to update. Can be null and can be an IPredicateExpression.
The relations to use with the filter. Can be null.
The number of entities updated.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.AuditDeleteOfEntity(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore)
member.summary: Audits the successful delete of an entity from the database
member.param: The entity which was deleted.
member.remarks: As the entity passed in was deleted succesfully, reading values from the passed in entity is only possible in this routine. After this call, the state of the entity will be reset to Deleted again and reading the fields will result in an exception. It's also recommended not to reference the passed in entity in any audit entity you might want to persist as the entity doesn't exist anymore in the database.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.AuditLoadOfEntity(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore)
member.summary: Audits the successful load of an entity from the database
member.param: The entity which was loaded. All data of the entity which was loaded is inside the entity.
member.remarks: Be careful when using this auditing routine, because the audit information is stored inside the auditor which is inside an entity which might not be persisted/deleted later on. This means that if you use the audit data to produce entities which are then returned by GetAuditEntitiesToSave are never persisted if the entity this auditor is the auditor of is never persisted/deleted. In that situation, to get reliable journalling, use an external service to log the audit data.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.AuditDirectDeleteOfEntities(System.Type,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPredicate,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRelationCollection,System.Int32)
member.summary: Audits the successful direct delete of entities in the database
member.param: The type of entity of which entities were deleted.
The filter to filter out the entities to delete. Can be null and can be an IPredicateExpression.
The relations to use with the filter. Can be null.
The number of entities deleted.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.GetAuditEntitiesToSave
member.summary: Gets the audit entities to save. Audit entities contain the audit information stored inside this auditor.
member.returns: The list of audit entities to save, or null if there are no audit entities to save
member.remarks: Do not remove the audit entities and audit information from this auditor when this method is called, as the transaction in which the save takes place can fail and retried which will result in another call to this method

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.RequiresTransactionForAuditEntities(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SingleStatementQueryAction)
member.summary: Method which returns true if this auditor expects to have audit entities to persist and therefore needs a transaction. This method is called in the situation when there's no transaction going on though one should be started right before the single-statement action in the case if the auditor has entities to save afterwards. It's recommended to return true if the auditor might have audit entities to persist after an entity save/delete/direct update/direct delete of entities. Default: true
member.param: The single statement action which is about to be started.
member.returns: true if a transaction should be started prior to the action to perform (entity save/delete/direct update/direct delete of entities) false otherwise.
member.remarks: If false is returned and GetAuditEntitiesToSave returns 1 or more entities, a new transaction is started to save these audit entities which means that this transaction isn't re-tryable if this transaction might fail.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.TransactionCommitted
member.summary: The transaction with which the audit entities requested from GetAuditEntitiesToSave were saved. Use this method to clear any audit data in this auditor as all audit information is persisted successfully.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.WriteXml(System.Xml.XmlWriter,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.XmlFormatAspect,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Guid,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity2})
member.summary: Method to serialze audit data to XML. Use the aspects passed in to determine various aspects of the XML format. If the audit data consists of entity instances, be sure to pass the passed in processedObjectIDs object to the WriteXml routine of IEntity2, so use the overload of IEntity2.WriteXml() which accepts a reader and the processedObjectIDs. Though it's recommended not to serialize entity objects in audit data, keep audit data as clean as possible from entity references. The start element 'Auditor' has already been written, the end element /Auditor will be written for you after this routine.
member.param: The writer.
The aspects.
The objectIDs of entities already serialized.
member.remarks: Adapter specific.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.ReadXml(System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Reads the auditor data XML.
member.param: The auditor node, which is the node of the Auditor element. The elements serialized by WriteXml are the children of this node.
member.remarks: Adapter specific. Used in Verbose/Compact scenarios. For Compact25 format, use the XmlReader consuming overload.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.ReadXml(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Reads the auditor data XML.
member.param: The xml reader to read the xml from. The reader is positioned on the Auditor element. The elements serialized by WriteXml are the children of this element. Read all xml till the reader is positioned on the end element of the Auditor element
member.remarks: Adapter specific, Compact25 specific. For Verbose/Compact scenario's use the XmlNode consuming overload

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuditor.HasDataToXmlSerialize
member.summary: Gets if the auditor object has data which should be Xml serialized. If this property returns false, no serialization (and thus no deserialization) will take place of the data to XML.
member.remarks: Used in Adapter

member.summary: Abstract base class for authorizers in the LLBLGen Pro system. Use this class to easily create authorizers.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuthorizer
member.summary: Interface for the authorizer to be used with entity instances at runtime. Authorizers authorize at runtime field get/set actions as well as save/load/delete actions on entities.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuthorizer.CanGetFieldValue(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the caller can obtain the value for the field with the index specified from the entity type specified.
member.param: The entity instance to obtain the value from.
Index of the field to obtain the value for.
member.returns: true if the caller is allowed to obtain the value, false otherwise

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuthorizer.CanSetFieldValue(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the caller can set the value for the field with the index specified of the entity type specified.
member.param: The entity instance the field is located in.
Index of the field to set the value of.
member.returns: true if the caller is allowed to set the value, false otherwise

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IAuthorizer.CanLoadEntity(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore)
member.summary: Determines whether the caller is allowed to load the data into the entity instance specified.
member.param: The entity instance to fill with data
member.returns: true if the caller is allowed to load the data in the entity specified.
member.remarks: Data inside the entity is the data fetched from the db. If the method returns false, the entity will be reset with a new set of empty fields

member.summary: Determines whether the caller is allowed to save the modified existing instance passed in.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.CollectionCore`1.DoNotPerformAddIfPresent
member.summary: When set to true, an entity passed to Add() or Insert() will be tested if it's already present. If so, the index is returned and the object is not added again. If set to false (default: true) this check is not performed. Setting this property to true can slow down fetch logic. DataAccessAdapter's fetch logic sets this property to false during a multi-entity fetch.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.CollectionCore`1.AllowRemove
member.summary: Default: false. If set to true, entities can be removed through databinding.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.CollectionCore`1.AllowEdit
member.summary: Default: true. If set to false, entities inside this collection won't be editable in a complex databinding scenario.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context
member.summary: General Context class which provides uniquing support for the object fetcher. A developer can use this class to create a space for objects where every entity is loaded just once.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new instance.
member.param: Flag to set existing entity fields in get. Default is true. When set to false, an existing entity's fields is not set to the fields of the passed in entity. Fields are only set if the entity isn't dirty.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.Clear
member.summary: Clears this context. It removes all cached entity references from this context and also all type definitions.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.Add(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity)
member.summary: Adds the specified entity to the Context. If the passed in entity is already in a context, the Add is a no-op. Also if the entity isn't new and there is already an entity with the same PK values, the Add is a no-op.
member.param: entity to add to this context.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.Add(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity2)
member.summary: Adds the specified entity to the Context. If the passed in entity is already in a context, the Add is a no-op. Also if the entity isn't new and there is already an entity with the same PK values, the Add is a no-op.
member.param: entity to add to this context.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.Add(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection)
member.summary: Adds the specified collection to this context. All contained entities are added to the context as well, if they're not already in the / a context. This will make sure that any entity added to the entity collection will be added to this context as well.
member.param: To add.
member.remarks: SelfServicing specific version

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.Add(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection2)
member.summary: Adds the specified collection to this context. All contained entities are added to the context as well, if they're not already in the / a context. This will make sure that any entity added to the entity collection will be added to this context as well.
member.param: To add.
member.remarks: Adapter specific version

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.EntitySaveCommitted``1(``0)
member.summary: After an entity has been saved and the transaction has been committed (or if no transaction was used: the entity was saved), this routine is called to move entities which are in the list of new entities and which are now saved to the store.
member.param: Entity.
member.remarks: Routine for the framework, you don't have to call this routine yourself

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.GetAll(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns a readonly arraylist with all the objects of the type passed in which are currently stored in the internal object cache. No new entities are returned. If the type is not found, an empty array list is returned.
member.param: The type of the entity for which the objects should be returned.
member.returns: List with the requested data

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.GetAllTypes
member.summary: Gets all the Type objects for which objects are located in this Context
member.returns: List with the requested data

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.Get(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity)
member.summary: The passed in entity is checked if the contained data is already in this / a context in another entity object. If that's the case, that entity object is returned. If the data is not in this context in another entity object, the passed in entity is returned and added to this context.
member.param: entity to check
member.returns: an already loaded entity with the same data, or the passed in entity if the data hasn't been loaded in another entity in this context or the entity passed in is new or the existing entity is deleted and its transaction has been completed.
member.remarks: if toCheck is new, it is added to the new entities pool (if not already present) and its context is set to this instance. New entities aren't yet added to the context until they're saved. A new entity passed in is returned as well. SelfServicing specific version.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.Get(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity2)
member.summary: The passed in entity is checked if the contained data is already in this / a context in another entity object.
member.param: entity to check
member.returns: an already loaded entity with the same data, or the passed in entity if the data hasn't been loaded in another entity in this context or the entity passed in is new or the existing entity is deleted and its transaction has been completed.
member.remarks: if toCheck is new, it is added to the new entities pool (if not already present) and its context is set to this instance. New entities aren't yet added to the context until they're saved. A new entity passed in is returned as well. Adapter specific version

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.Get(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFactory,System.Object[])
member.summary: Tries to find an entity with the same PK values as passed in. The PK values have to be in the same order as they appear in the constructor of the entity. If an entity in the context has the same PK values, that entity is returned, otherwise a new entity is returned, created with the factory passed in, with its PK values initialized, though not fetched.
member.param: Factory to use for entity to find
Pk values. Have to be specified in the same order as the PK fields in the entity constructor created by the factory passed in.
member.returns: Entity with the same PK values if that entity was already added to the context, or a new entity if no entity was previously added to this context with the same PK values
member.exception: if more/less pkvalues are passed in as there are in the PK of the entity created with the factory passed in
member.remarks: SelfServicing specific version

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.Get(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFactory2,System.Object[])
member.summary: Tries to find an entity with the same PK values as passed in. The PK values have to be in the same order as they appear in the constructor of the entity. If an entity in the context has the same PK values, that entity is returned, otherwise a new entity is returned, created with the factory passed in, with its PK values initialized, though not fetched.
member.param: Factory to use for entity to find
Pk values. Have to be specified in the same order as the PK fields in the entity constructor created by the factory passed in.
member.returns: Entity with the same PK values if that entity was already added to the context, or a new entity if no entity was previously added to this context with the same PK values
member.exception: if more/less pkvalues are passed in as there are in the PK of the entity created with the factory passed in
member.remarks: Adapter specific version

member.summary: Removes the specified entity from the store
member.param: To remove.
member.remarks: generic version for both SelfServicing and Adapter.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.FindEntity``1(``0)
member.summary: Tries to find the passed in entity in the store, based on its contained data. It assumes the passed in entity isn't new.
member.param: Entity object which contains entity data to

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.AddEntity(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore)
member.summary: Adds the entity passed in. The entity passed in is not new and the object isn't in the store as it isn't in a context yet. It assumes that there is no entity with the same PK in the store, as that's checked by the public Add() methods.
member.param: entity to add

member.summary: Adds the specified entity to the Context. If the passed in entity is already in a context, the Add is a no-op. Also if the entity isn't new and there is already an entity with the same PK values, the Add is a no-op.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context.SetExistingEntityFieldsInGet
member.summary: Gets / sets SetExistingEntityFieldsInGet flag. When set to false (default is true), an existing entity's fields is not set to the fields of the passed in entity. Fields are only set if the entity isn't dirty.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ScaleOverflowCorrectionAction
member.summary: Enum which defines the action to take when a scale overflow is detected in the build-in validation for precision/scale values. This validation takes place when an entity field is set to a value and the validation isn't bypassed.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ScaleOverflowCorrectionAction.None
member.summary: No action is taken, and the exception resulting from the scale overflow detection is thrown.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ScaleOverflowCorrectionAction.Truncate
member.summary: Default. Chop off the digits which overflow the scale. Examples: scale is 2: 10.456 becomes 10.45. 10.450 becomes 10.45
member.remarks: SqlServer users should use this option if they want to mimic the SqlClient build-in truncation code.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ScaleOverflowCorrectionAction.Round
member.summary: Round the fraction to a value which fits the scale and round values using Math.Round(value, scale)

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.BuildInValidationBypass
member.summary: Enum which defines the strategy for the build-in validation logic for new values for entity fields. Build-in validation logic checks if the value to set matches the characteristics of the database field the entity field is mapped on, so when the entity is persisted there won't be any overflow exception.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.BuildInValidationBypass.NoBypass
member.summary: Default. Don't bypass the build-in validation logic and only call the validator if the build-in validation checks succeed.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.BuildInValidationBypass.AlwaysBypass
member.summary: Always bypass the build-in validation logic, even if there's no validator set for the entity.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.BuildInValidationBypass.BypassWhenValidatorPresent
member.summary: Only bypass the build-in validation logic if the entity has a validator object set. Otherwise execute the build-in validation logic

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ExceptionInfoElement
member.summary: Enum which is used to identify the various info elements in a db specific exception info hashtable/dictionary.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ExceptionInfoElement.ErrorCode
member.summary: The HRESULT error code (if available).

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ExceptionInfoElement.ErrorObjects
member.summary: The set of error objects (e.g. SqlError, OracleError etc. objects) contained by the exception

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ExceptionInfoElement.ErrorNumber
member.summary: The error number as reported by the db engine.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ExceptionInfoElement.ServerName
member.summary: The server name or datasource the error occured on.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ExceptionInfoElement.Hint
member.summary: A hint provided by the db engine how to solve the error.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ExceptionInfoElement.Message
member.summary: The error message. This message is also copied to the exception message.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ExceptionInfoElement.HelpLink
member.summary: Link to help documentation about this error.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SerializedType
member.summary: Enum which is used for fast serialization. It stores information about a type or type/value.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SerializationOptimization
member.summary: Enum which defines the serialization settings available.
member.remarks: Adapter specific

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SerializationOptimization.None
member.summary: Uses the original LLBLGenPro serialization/deserialization code

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SerializationOptimization.Fast
member.summary: Uses the fast serialization code for compact, fast serialization. If you use this option, be sure that the deserialization has to take place using this same code.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SingleStatementQueryAction
member.summary: Enum which is used in Auditors, to signal that this single statement query action is about to be executed and that the framework would like to know if the auditor expects to have entities to save after the statement so a transaction should be started.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SingleStatementQueryAction.NewEntityInsert
member.summary: An insert of a new entity is about to be started

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SingleStatementQueryAction.ExistingEntityUpdate
member.summary: An update of an existing entity is about to be started

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SingleStatementQueryAction.EntityDelete
member.summary: A delete of an existing entity is about to be started

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SingleStatementQueryAction.DirectUpdateEntities
member.summary: A direct update of entities in the database with a single update statement is about to be started

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SingleStatementQueryAction.DirectDeleteEntities
member.summary: A direct delete of entities in the database with a single delete statement is about to be started

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FetchNewAuthorizationFailureResultHint
member.summary: Enum to specify the hint what to do when authorization fails on a newly fetched entity into a new object.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FetchNewAuthorizationFailureResultHint.ClearData
member.summary: Clear the data of the entity. The entity is added to the collection, if the fetch was a collection fetch.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FetchNewAuthorizationFailureResultHint.ThrowAway
member.summary: The entity is thrown out and not added to a collection, if the fetch was a collection fetch. This is the default.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DependencyInjectionTargetKind
member.summary: Enum defined for dependency injection information, to specify the targetkind

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DependencyInjectionTargetKind.Absolute
member.summary: The instance will be injected only in the type specified as targettype, all subtypes of targettype won't get the instance injected

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DependencyInjectionTargetKind.Hierarchy
member.summary: The instance will be injected in the type specified as targettype and all subtypes of targettype. This is the default.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DependencyInjectionContextType
member.summary: Enum defined to specify in which context the instance to inject lives in.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DependencyInjectionContextType.NewInstancePerTarget
member.summary: every target gets a new instance of the instance type injected. This is the default.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DependencyInjectionContextType.Singleton
member.summary: Every target gets the same instance of the instance type injected.
member.remarks: The singleton instance is thread-specific, so different threads have different singletons

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DataSourceSortingMode
member.summary: Enum definition for LLBLGenProDataSource(2) controls to signal what sorting mode they have to use for selects.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DataSourceSortingMode.ServerSide
member.summary: Use server-side sorting, which will use solely entity fields (default)

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DataSourceSortingMode.ClientSide
member.summary: Use client-side sorting, which will use all properties specified, also non-field properties.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DataSourceCacheLocation
member.summary: Enum to define the data cache to use for the LLBLGen Pro DataSource controls in an ASP.NET application

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DataSourceCacheLocation.ViewState
member.summary: Data is stored in the viewstate. Default.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DataSourceCacheLocation.Session
member.summary: Data is stored in the Session object using a key which is unique for control instance - page combination.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DataSourceCacheLocation.ASPNetCache
member.summary: Data is stored in the ASPNet cache using a GUID based key. As the data cached is used in a post-back scenario when data has changed, the duration of the cached data is set to the value specified in the ASPNetCacheDuration property of the datasource control. Duration is always sliding, i.e. expires after ASPNetCacheDuration if the data hasn't been requested from the ASPNet cache.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DataSourceDataContainerType
member.summary: Enum which specifies the type of object which contains the data in an LLBLGenProDataSource(2) control in an ASP.NET application

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DataSourceDataContainerType.EntityCollection
member.summary: The object containing the data is an entity collection (selfservicing style or adapter style).

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DataSourceDataContainerType.TypedList
member.summary: The object containing the data is a typed list

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DataSourceDataContainerType.TypedView
member.summary: The object containing the data is a typed view.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.MemberOperator
member.summary: Enum which specifies when the MemberPredicate should be considered 'true'

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.MemberOperator.All
member.summary: The contained filter in the MemberPredicate has to return true for all elements in the specified member.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.MemberOperator.Any
member.summary: The contained filter in the MemberPredicate has to return true for at least one element in the specified member.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.MemberOperator.Null
member.summary: The specified member has no data. The specified filter of the MemberPredicate is ignored. This operator can for example be used to test if the specified member is set, e.g. filter on all OrderEntity instances which have Customer set to an instance.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SqlServerCompatibilityLevel
member.summary: Enum for compatibility level in the SqlServer DQE

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SqlServerCompatibilityLevel.SqlServer7
member.summary: Produce SQL which is compatible with SqlServer 7 and up

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SqlServerCompatibilityLevel.SqlServer2000
member.summary: Produce SQL which is compatible with SqlServer 2000 and up (default)

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SqlServerCompatibilityLevel.SqlServer2005
member.summary: Produce SQL which is compatible with SqlServer 2005 and up

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.PostCollectionChangeAction
member.summary: Enum to specify what to do when the data in the related collection of an entity view changes. A change in data can be: entity added or changed. If an entity is removed from the underlying collection, the entity is simply removed from the entity view, as the view doesn't contain any data by itself.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.PostCollectionChangeAction.NoAction
member.summary: A set filter or sorter isn't re-applied to the changed entity/ies, so the change won't affect the order of the entities in the view nor which rows are in the view.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.PostCollectionChangeAction.ReapplyFilterAndSorter
member.summary: The set filter and the set sorter are re-applied to the entity which caused the change. This is the default and will make the entity view a true 'live' view on the related entity collection

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.PostCollectionChangeAction.ReapplySorter
member.summary: The set sorter is re-applied to the entities in the view.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ConcurrencyPredicateType
member.summary: Enum to specify to the IConcurrencyPredicateFactory what kind of predicate to produce

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ConcurrencyPredicateType.Save
member.summary: The predicate type requested is for a Save action

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ConcurrencyPredicateType.Delete
member.summary: The predicate type requested is for a Delete action

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.InheritanceHierarchyType
member.summary: Enum definition for defining the hierarchy type of the inheritance tree

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.InheritanceHierarchyType.None
member.summary: No hierarchy defined for this entity or the entity isn't the root entity.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.InheritanceHierarchyType.TargetPerEntityHierarchy
member.summary: All entities map to the single target (table/view)

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.InheritanceHierarchyType.TargetPerEntity
member.summary: Per entity a target (table/view) is defined, with just the fields of the derived entity, not the fields of the parent entity.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.UnitOfWorkBlockType
member.summary: Enum which is used to specify block types, to identity groups of actions under the same type, e.g. inserts or updates.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.UnitOfWorkBlockType.Inserts
member.summary: All entity insert actions

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.UnitOfWorkBlockType.Updates
member.summary: All entity update actions

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.UnitOfWorkBlockType.Deletes
member.summary: All entity delete actions.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.UnitOfWorkBlockType.DeletesPerformedDirectly
member.summary: All delete actions performed directly on the database.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.UnitOfWorkBlockType.UpdatesPerformedDirectly
member.summary: All update actions performed directly on the database.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.UnitOfWorkCallBackScheduleSlot
member.summary: Enum definition to tell the UnitOfWork that the passed in callback should be executed in the slot specified. Entities are executed in the order: Insert, Update, Delete.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.UnitOfWorkCallBackScheduleSlot.PreEntityInsert
member.summary: Execute the callback before the first entity is inserted.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.UnitOfWorkCallBackScheduleSlot.PreEntityUpdate
member.summary: Execute the callback after the last entity has been inserted but before the first entity will be updated.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.UnitOfWorkCallBackScheduleSlot.PreEntityDelete
member.summary: Execute the callback after the last entity has been updated but before the first entity will be deleted.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.UnitOfWorkCallBackScheduleSlot.PostEntityDelete
member.summary: Execute the callback after the last entity has been deleted.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.XmlFormatAspect
member.summary: Enum definition for the flags which can be passed to overloads of WriteXml(). These flags control the way the format of the output.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.XmlFormatAspect.None
member.summary: No aspects have been specified, the defaults are used.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.XmlFormatAspect.Compact
member.summary: Produces more compact XML. This xml doesn't contain type information attributes, nor non-data fields for objects. The default is verbose.
member.remarks: Adapter: it's recommended that you use Compact25 instead of this format as it's more compact and faster to deserialize.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.XmlFormatAspect.MLTextInCDataBlocks
member.summary: Places all strings with a < and or > in CDATA blocks. The default is not to do this.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.XmlFormatAspect.DatesInXmlDataType
member.summary: Exports all DateTime values in the standard date/time format for XML: DateTime.ToString("yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fffffffzzzzzz");. The default is to export DateTime values in ticks.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.XmlFormatAspect.Compact25
member.summary: Adapter specific. More optimal XML than Compact, introduced in v2.5. Use this format to have the most compact XML output which still contains change tracking/state information for full round-tripping support for entities and entity graphs. If both Compact and Compact25 are specified, Compact25 is used. Webservice support code in Adapter uses Compact25.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.CatalogNameUsage
member.summary: SqlServer specific enum definition for Adapter template set. Specifies for the active DataAccessAdapter object what to do with the catalog name in persistence information set into fields.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.CatalogNameUsage.Default
member.summary: Use default behaviour, which means that nothing is done to the catalog name specified in the persistence info.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.CatalogNameUsage.ForceName
member.summary: Force the name specified in the property DataAccessAdapter.CatalogNameToUse.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.CatalogNameUsage.Clear
member.summary: Clears the catalog name specified in the persistence information. This means that the catalog name specified in the connection string is used by SqlServer where to locate specified tables etc.. Clearing of the catalog name makes the SqlServer DQE ignore the catalog name when generating names.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SchemaNameUsage
member.summary: Oracle specific enum definition for Adapter template set. Specifies for the active DataAccessAdapter object what to do with the schema name in persistence information set into fields.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SchemaNameUsage.Default
member.summary: Use default behaviour, which means that nothing is done to the schema name specified in the persistence info.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SchemaNameUsage.ForceName
member.summary: Force the name specified in the property DataAccessAdapter.SchemaNameToUse.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SchemaNameUsage.Clear
member.summary: Clears the Schema name specified in the persistence information. This means that the schema name specified in the persistence info is cleared. This results in the fact that database objects are not prefixed with a schema, and will only result in a succesful query if global synonym equivalents are available.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityState
member.summary: Enum definition for the state an Entity can be in.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityState.New
member.summary: Entity is new. It can be empty or filled, but is not saved (yet) to the persistent storage.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityState.Fetched
member.summary: Entity is filled with its data from the persistent storage. It can be changed since the fetch.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityState.OutOfSync
member.summary: Entity is out of sync with its physical entity in the persistent storage. An Entity is marked OutOfSync when a succesful Save action is performed. An Entity will re-fetch itself when in the state OutOfSync when a property is read or Refetch() is called. The state will then be set to Fetched.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityState.Deleted
member.summary: Adapter specific. If an entity has the state Deleted, it is no longer available in the persistent storage.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateFunction
member.summary: Enum definition for the various aggregate functions which can be applied to fields in a retrieval query. Useful in typed lists. Use these in combination with a groupbycollection. Not all functions are legal on all fields. Some functions will produce errors when used with fields of a given type, like a Sum function with a character field. This is the responsibility of the developer. Aggregate functions are never applied to *lob fields.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateFunction.None
member.summary: Default, do not apply an aggregate function to the field.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateFunction.Count
member.summary: Calculates the amount of rows for the field. Results in COUNT(field)

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateFunction.CountDistinct
member.summary: Calculates the amount of rows with distinct values for field. Results in COUNT(DISTINCT field). Access, MySql: not supported

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateFunction.CountRow
member.summary: Calculates the amount of rows. Results in a COUNT(*)

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateFunction.Avg
member.summary: Calculates the average value for the field. Results in an AVG(field)
member.remarks: works on numeric fields (decimal/int/float/byte/etc.) only

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateFunction.AvgDistinct
member.summary: Calculates the average value for the distinct values for field. Results in an AVG(DISTINCT field). Access, MySql: not supported
member.remarks: works on numeric fields (decimal/int/float/byte/etc.) only

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateFunction.Max
member.summary: Calculates the max value for field. Results in a MAX(field).
member.remarks: works on numeric fields (decimal/int/float/byte/etc.) only

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateFunction.Min
member.summary: Calculates the min value for field. Results in a MIN(field)
member.remarks: works on numeric fields (decimal/int/float/byte/etc.) only

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateFunction.Sum
member.summary: Calculates the sum of all values of field. Results in a SUM(field)
member.remarks: works on numeric fields (decimal/int/float/byte/etc.) only

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateFunction.SumDistinct
member.summary: Calculates the sum of all distinct values of field. Results in a SUM(DISTINCT field). Access, MySql: not supported
member.remarks: works on numeric fields (decimal/int/float/byte/etc.) only

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateFunction.StDev
member.summary:
Calculates statistical standard deviation. Results in: SqlServer: STDEV(field)
Oracle, MySql: STDDEV(field)
Access: STDEV(field)
Firebird: not supported
member.remarks: Works on float fields only

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateFunction.StDevDistinct
member.summary:
Calculates statistical standard deviation over distinct values. Results in: SqlServer: not supported
Oracle: STDDEV(DISTINCT field)
Access, Firebird, MySql: not supported
member.remarks: Works on float fields only

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateFunction.Variance
member.summary:
Calculates statistical variance. Results in: SqlServer: VAR(field)
Oracle, MySql: VARIANCE(field)
Access: VAR(field)
Firebird: not supported.
member.remarks: Works on float fields only

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateFunction.VarianceDistinct
member.summary:
Calculates statistical variance over distinct values. Results in: SqlServer: not supported
Oracle: VARIANCE(DISTINCT field)
Access, Firebird, MySql: not supported
member.remarks: Works on float fields only

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateSetFunction
member.summary: Enum definition for the various aggregate functions supported by the for in-memory filters.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateSetFunction.Count
member.summary: Calculates the amount of elements matching the specified filter. Result is of type Int32

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateSetFunction.CountDistinct
member.summary: Calculates the amount of elements matching the specified filter, ignoring duplicates. Result is of type Int32. NULL/DBNull.Value is counted as a value.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateSetFunction.Avg
member.summary: Calculates the average value for the values in the set. Result is of type Decimal.
member.remarks: works on numeric fields (decimal/int/float/byte/etc.) only.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateSetFunction.AvgDistinct
member.summary: Calculates the average value for the values in the set, excluding duplicates. Result is of type Decimal
member.remarks: works on numeric fields (decimal/int/float/byte/etc.) only

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateSetFunction.Max
member.summary: Calculates the max value for the values in the set. Result is of the type of the values in the set.
member.remarks: works on numeric fields (decimal/int/float/byte/etc.) only

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateSetFunction.Min
member.summary: Calculates the min value for the values in the set. Result is of the type of the values in the set.
member.remarks: works on numeric fields (decimal/int/float/byte/etc.) only

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateSetFunction.Sum
member.summary: Calculates the sum of all values in the set. Result is of the type of the values in the set.
member.remarks: works on numeric fields (decimal/int/float/byte/etc.) only

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.AggregateSetFunction.SumDistinct
member.summary: Calculates the sum of all values in the set excluding duplicates. Result is of the type of the values in the set.
member.remarks: works on numeric fields (decimal/int/float/byte/etc.) only

member.summary: Reads the data of the entity passed in, and returns that object. Which data is read is determined using the set Primary Key field(s). If specified, it also processes the prefetch path.
member.param: The entity to fetch. Contained data will be overwritten.
A containing transaction, if caller is added to a transaction, or null if not.
Select filter.
the PrefetchPath which defines the graph of objects to fetch.
The context to fetch the prefetch path with.

The list of IEntityField objects which have to be excluded or included for the fetch. If null or empty, all fields are fetched (default). If an instance of ExcludeIncludeFieldsList is passed in and its ExcludeContainedFields property is set to false, the fields contained in excludedIncludedFields are kept in the query, the rest of the fields in the query are excluded.

member.summary: Retrieves in the calling Collection object all Entity objects which match with the specified filter, formulated in the predicate or predicate expression definition, using the passed in relations to construct the total query.
member.param: A containing transaction, if caller is added to a transaction, or null if not.
Collection to fill with the entity objects retrieved

The maximum number of items to return with this retrieval query. If the used Dynamic Query Engine supports it, 'TOP' is used to limit the amount of rows to return. When set to 0, no limitations are specified.
The order by specifications for the sorting of the resultset. When not specified, no sorting is applied.
The EntityFactory to use when creating entity objects during a GetMulti() call.
A predicate or predicate expression which should be used as filter for the entities to retrieve.
The set of relations to walk to construct to total query.
The page number to retrieve.
The page size of the page to retrieve.
member.returns: true if succeeded, false otherwise

member.summary: Updates all entities of the same type or subtype of the entity entityWithNewValues directly in the persistent storage if they match the filter supplied in filterBucket. Only the fields changed in entityWithNewValues are updated for these fields. Entities of a subtype of the type of entityWithNewValues which are affected by the filterBucket's filter will thus also be updated.
member.param: IEntity instance which holds the new values for the matching entities to update. Only changed fields are taken into account
A containing transaction, if caller is added to a transaction, or null if not.
A predicate or predicate expression which should be used as filter for the entities to update.
member.returns: Number of entities affected, if the used persistent storage has rowcounting enabled. Use the returned value to determine if the update succeeded (value > 0)

member.summary: Loads the data for the excluded fields specified in the list of excluded fields into the entity passed in.

A containing transaction, if caller is added to a transaction, or null if not.

The excludedIncludedFields object as it is used when fetching the passed in entity. If you used the excludedIncludedFields object to fetch only the fields in that list (i.e. excludedIncludedFields.ExcludeContainedFields==false), the routine will fetch all other fields in the resultset for the entities in the collection excluding the fields in excludedIncludedFields.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IDao.FetchExcludedFields(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ITransaction,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ExcludeIncludeFieldsList)
member.summary: Loads the data for the excluded fields specified in the list of excluded fields into all the entities in the entities collection passed in.
member.param: The entities to load the excluded field data into. The entities have to be either of the same type or have to be in the same inheritance hierarchy as the entity which factory is set in the collection.
A containing transaction, if caller is added to a transaction, or null if not.

The excludedIncludedFields object as it is used when fetching the passed in collection. If you used the excludedIncludedFields object to fetch only the fields in that list (i.e. excludedIncludedFields.ExcludeContainedFields==false), the routine will fetch all other fields in the resultset for the entities in the collection excluding the fields in excludedIncludedFields.
member.remarks: The field data is set like a normal field value set, so authorization is applied to it. This routine batches fetches to have at most 5*ParameterizedThreshold of parameters per fetch. Keep in mind that most databases have a limit on the # of parameters per query.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IDao.EntityFactoryToUse
member.summary: Gets / sets entityFactory to use

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DaoBase.ParameterisedPrefetchPathThreshold
member.summary:
The parameterised prefetch path threshold. This threshold is used to determine when the prefetch path logic should switch to a subquery or when it should use a WHERE field IN (value1, value2, ... valueN) construct, based on the # of elements in the parent collection. If that # of elements exceeds this threshold, a subquery is constructed, otherwise field IN (value1, value2, ...) construct is used. The default value is 50. On average, this is faster than using a subquery which returns 50 elements. Use this to tune prefetch path fetch logic for your particular needs.
This threshold is also used to determine if paging is possible. A page size bigger than this threshold will disable the paging functionality when using paging + prefetch paths.
member.remarks:
Testing showed that values larger than 300 will be slower than a subquery. This setting is a global setting, so will affect all database actions after setting it to a new value.
Special thanks to Marcus Mac Innes (http://www.styledesign.biz) for this optimization code.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DaoBase.FetchExistingPolymorphic(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ITransaction,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFields,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ExcludeIncludeFieldsList)
member.summary: Performs the polymorphic entity fetch for the entity type of this DAO. It will produce an entity of that type or a subtype of that type, based on the values retrieved, or an empty entity if not found. The passed in fields object has its PK fields filled, which are used to produce a PK filter.
member.param: Containing transaction.
Fields required for PK construction
Context to use for fetch

The list of IEntityField objects which have to be excluded or included for the fetch. If null or empty, all fields are fetched (default). If an instance of ExcludeIncludeFieldsList is passed in and its ExcludeContainedFields property is set to false, the fields contained in excludedIncludedFields are kept in the query, the rest of the fields in the query are excluded.
member.returns: New entity with the data filtered by the passed in PK filter, or an empty entity if not found. Entity can be of type produced by the set entity factory (which produces entities of the type this DAO is for) or a subtype.

member.summary: Updates all entities of the same type or subtype of the entity entityWithNewValues directly in the persistent storage if they match the filter supplied in filterBucket. Only the fields changed in entityWithNewValues are updated for these fields. Entities of a subtype of the type of entityWithNewValues which are affected by the filterBucket's filter will thus also be updated.
member.param: IEntity instance which holds the new values for the matching entities to update. Only changed fields are taken into account
A containing transaction, if caller is added to a transaction, or null if not.
A predicate or predicate expression which should be used as filter for the entities to update.
member.returns: Number of entities affected, if the used persistent storage has rowcounting enabled. Use the returned value to determine if the update succeeded (value > 0)

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DaoBase.FetchExcludedFields(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ITransaction,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ExcludeIncludeFieldsList)

A containing transaction, if caller is added to a transaction, or null if not.

The excludedIncludedFields object as it is used when fetching the entitycollection. If you used the excludedIncludedFields object to fetch only the fields in that list (i.e. excludedIncludedFields.ExcludeContainedFields==false), the routine will fetch all other fields in the resultset for the entities in the collection excluding the fields in excludedIncludedFields.
member.remarks: The field data is set like a normal field value set, so authorization is applied to it. This routine batches fetches to have at most 5*ParameterisedPrefetchPathThreshold of parameters per fetch. Keep in mind that most databases have a limit on the # of parameters per query.

The exception thrown by GetValues(toFill)

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.DaoBase.CheckForDuplicate(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity}}@,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int32,System.Object}@)
member.summary: Checks if the passed in entity is present in the hashtables passed in. If so
member.param: Entity which has to be tested if there was already a duplicate in the hashtables.
See remarks
See remarks
member.returns: true if there is no duplicate for hte passed in entity seen yet. False otherwise
member.remarks: construct hashtable for filtering out duplicates. Each hashtable entry is at first a section of empty cells. When a hashcode is found in the set of hashes, add an entry, if not existend to this hashtable. When the hashcode already is added to this hashtable, the entity of the new hashcode is compared to all the entities with the same hashcode in the list related to the hashcode in this table. when an equal object is found, it's a real duplicate, otherwise the entity is added to the list and the collection.

member.summary: Starts a new transaction. All database activity after this call will be ran in this transaction and all objects will participate in this transaction until its committed or rolled back. If there is a transaction in progress, an exception is thrown. Will create and open a new connection if a transaction is not open and/or available.
member.param: The isolation level to use for this transaction
The name for this transaction
member.exception: If a transaction is already in progress.

member.summary: Creates a savepoint with the name savePointName in the current transaction. You can roll back to this savepoint using .
member.param: name of savepoint. Must be unique in an active transaction
member.exception: If no transaction is in progress.
if savePointName is empty or null
if the .NET database provider doesn't support transaction saving or when COM+ is used.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IDataAccessAdapter.Commit
member.summary: Commits the transaction in action. It will end all database activity, since commiting a transaction is finalizing it. After calling Commit or Rollback, the ITransaction implementing class will reset itself.
member.remarks: Will close the active connection unless KeepConnectionOpen has been set to true

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IDataAccessAdapter.Rollback
member.summary: Rolls back the transaction in action. It will end all database activity, since commiting a transaction is finalizing it. After calling Commit or Rollback, the ITransaction implementing class will reset itself.
member.remarks: Will close the active connection unless KeepConnectionOpen has been set to true

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IDataAccessAdapter.Rollback(System.String)
member.summary: Rolls back the transaction in action to the savepoint with the name savepointName. No internal objects are being reset when this method is called, so call this Rollback overload only to roll back to a savepoint. To roll back a complete transaction, call Rollback() without specifying a savepoint name. Create a savepoint by calling SaveTransaction(savePointName)
member.exception: If no transaction is in progress.
if savePointName is empty or null
if the .NET database provider doesn't support transaction rolling back a transaction to a named point or when COM+ is used.
member.param: name of the savepoint to roll back to.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IDataAccessAdapter.OpenConnection
member.summary: Opens the active connection object. If the connection is already open, nothing is done. If no connection object is present, a new one is created

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IDataAccessAdapter.CloseConnection
member.summary: Closes the active connection. If no connection is available or the connection is closed, nothing is done.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IDataAccessAdapter.SaveEntity(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity2)
member.summary: Saves the passed in entity to the persistent storage. Will not refetch the entity after this save. The entity will stay out-of-sync. If the entity is new, it will be inserted, if the entity is existent, the changed entity fields will be changed in the database. Will do a recursive save.
member.param: The entity to save
member.returns: true if the save was succesful, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Will use a current transaction if a transaction is in progress

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IDataAccessAdapter.SaveEntity(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity2,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves the passed in entity to the persistent storage. If the entity is new, it will be inserted, if the entity is existent, the changed entity fields will be changed in the database. Will do a recursive save. Will pass the concurrency predicate returned by GetConcurrencyPredicate(ConcurrencyPredicateType.Save) as update restriction.
member.param: The entity to save
When true, it will refetch the entity from the persistent storage so it will be up-to-date after the save action.
member.returns: true if the save was succesful, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Will use a current transaction if a transaction is in progress

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IDataAccessAdapter.SaveEntity(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity2,System.Boolean,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPredicateExpression)
member.summary: Saves the passed in entity to the persistent storage. If the entity is new, it will be inserted, if the entity is existent, the changed entity fields will be changed in the database. Will do a recursive save. Will pass the concurrency predicate returned by GetConcurrencyPredicate(ConcurrencyPredicateType.Save) as update restriction.
member.param: The entity to save
When true, it will refetch the entity from the persistent storage so it will be up-to-date after the save action.
Predicate expression, meant for concurrency checks in an Update query. Will be ignored when the entity is new.
member.returns: true if the save was succesful, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Will use a current transaction if a transaction is in progress

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IDataAccessAdapter.SaveEntity(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity2,System.Boolean,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPredicateExpression,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves the passed in entity to the persistent storage. If the entity is new, it will be inserted, if the entity is existent, the changed entity fields will be changed in the database.
member.param: The entity to save
When true, it will refetch the entity from the persistent storage so it will be up-to-date after the save action.
Predicate expression, meant for concurrency checks in an Update query. Will be ignored when the entity is new.
When true, it will save all dirty objects referenced (directly or indirectly) by entityToSave also.
member.returns: true if the save was succesful, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Will use a current transaction if a transaction is in progress

member.param: The entity object in which the fetched entity data will be stored. The primary key fields have to have a value.
The context to add the entity to if the fetch was succesful.
member.remarks: Will use a current transaction if a transaction is in progress, so MVCC or other concurrency scheme used by the database can be utilized
member.returns: true if the Fetch was succesful, false otherwise

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IDataAccessAdapter.FetchEntity(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity2,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPrefetchPath2,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context)
member.param: The entity object in which the fetched entity data will be stored. The primary key fields have to have a value.
The prefetch path to use for this fetch, which will fetch all related entities defined by the path as well.

The context to add the entity to if the fetch was succesful, and before the prefetch path is fetched. This ensures that the prefetch path is fetched using the context specified and will re-use already loaded entity objects.
member.remarks: Will use a current transaction if a transaction is in progress, so MVCC or other concurrency scheme used by the database can be utilized
member.returns: true if the Fetch was succesful, false otherwise

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IDataAccessAdapter.FetchEntity(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity2,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPrefetchPath2,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Context,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ExcludeIncludeFieldsList)
member.summary: Fetches an entity from the persistent storage into the passed in Entity2 object using a primary key filter. The primary key fields of the entity passed in have to have the primary key values. (Example: CustomerID has to have a value, when you want to fetch a CustomerEntity from the persistent storage into the passed in object). All fields specified in excludedFields are excluded from the fetch so the entity won't get any value set for those fields. excludedFields can be null or empty, in which case all fields are fetched (default).
member.param: The entity object in which the fetched entity data will be stored. The primary key fields have to have a value.
The prefetch path to use for this fetch, which will fetch all related entities defined by the path as well.

The context to add the entity to if the fetch was succesful, and before the prefetch path is fetched. This ensures that the prefetch path is fetched using the context specified and will re-use already loaded entity objects.

The list of IEntityField2 objects which have to be excluded or included for the fetch. If null or empty, all fields are fetched (default). If an instance of ExcludeIncludeFieldsList is passed in and its ExcludeContainedFields property is set to false, the fields contained in excludedIncludedFields are kept in the query, the rest of the fields in the query are excluded.
member.remarks: Will use a current transaction if a transaction is in progress, so MVCC or other concurrency scheme used by the database can be utilized
member.returns: true if the Fetch was succesful, false otherwise

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IDataAccessAdapter.FetchEntityUsingUniqueConstraint(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity2,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPredicateExpression)
member.summary: Fetches an entity from the persistent storage into the object specified using the filter specified. Use the entity's uniqueconstraint filter construction methods to construct the required uniqueConstraintFilter for the unique constraint you want to use.
member.param: The entity object in which the fetched entity data will be stored.
The filter which should filter on fields with a unique constraint.
member.returns: true if the Fetch was succesful, false otherwise

member.summary: Fetches a new entity using the filter/relation combination filter passed in via filterBucket and the new entity is created using the passed in entity factory. Use this method when fetching a related entity using a current entity (for example, fetch the related Customer entity of an existing Order entity)
member.param: The factory which will be used to create a new entity object which will be fetched

the completely filled in IRelationPredicateBucket object which will be used as a filter for the fetch. The fetch will only load the first entity loaded, even if the filter results into more entities being fetched
member.returns: The new entity fetched.
