member.summary: Will set the passed in information as Entity sync information. If there is no sync information stored yet for the related entity then a new entry is created, otherwise it's info is added to the sync information of this entity, if it isn't already present. If there is already sync information for this field stored for another related entity, that information is removed.
member.param: Name of field of this entity mapped onto passed in relation
related entity set as value for field with name fieldName
EntityRelation object which is the relation between this entity and the passed in relatedEntity

member.summary: Performs the desetup of the sync info related to the relatedentity passed in
member.param: The related entity.
The properties changed handler.
Name of the field.
The relation.
if set to true [disconnect from save event].

if set to true, it will signal the related entity that it's been dereferenced by calling it's UnsetRelatedEntity method. If the relation is a m:1 relation, the related entity is told not to signal us back IF resetFKFields is false. This is a special case because the 1:n location is in a collection and by telling the related entity not to signal us back, the related entity will use a silent remove on the collection, otherwise the remove is done by the public Remove method which will always signal us back. THe resetFKFields flag signals that this call originates from a location where FK fields are written manually, and the signal back from the related entity will do that again, if performed, hence the special case.
The field in related entity.
if set to true [reset FK fields].
The fk field indexes.

member.summary: Checks whether this instance has pending fk syncs. A pending FK sync is a sync which hasn't been used yet. If an entity has pending FK syncs, it has to be included into a save queue. Only syncs with entities in the passed in queue are considered. If a sync is with an entity which isn't in the passed in queue, the sync isn't honoured anyway, so the fk sync can be ignored.
member.param: Hashtable of the entities which are currently scheduled to be saved in the queue. A pending sync has to be with an entity in this queue

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.MakeInvalidFieldReadsFatal
member.summary: Flag (default: false), which can be used to track down errors in code at runtime when migrating from LLBLGen Pro v1.0.xx to v2.0. When set to true, it will make invalid field reads fatal and will make the entity throw an ORMInvalidFieldReadException when a field is read while the field's value hasn't been set yet.
member.remarks:
This is to track down the following errors:
OrderEntity order = new OrderEntity(); order.SomeNullableField+=10;
This code resulted in the value 10 in v1.0, but will result in 0 in v2, if you're using .NET 2.0. This is caused by the fact that SomeNullableField is null/Nothing in v2 when the entity is initialized, not 0. By switching on this flag you can track down these errors at runtime.
It will cause problems with asp.net grids and new entities, so use this flag only for checking the code after you've migrated to v2.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.BuildInValidationBypassMode
member.summary: The mode (default: NoBypass) to use for the build-in validation checks. Build-in validation checks are performed on every value a field is set to, unless this mode is set to a different value than NoBypass which makes the code to bypass these build-in validation checks. The build-in validation checks are used to prevent overflow exceptions when the entity is persisted to the database.
member.remarks: You can also set this field by adding a key-value pair to the appSettings section of your application's config file. Use 'buildInValidationBypassMode' as key and the numeric value of the BuildInValidationBypass enum value as value.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.MarkSavedEntitiesAsFetched
member.summary: Flag (default: false) which controls if saved entities which aren't fetched back in the same call should be marked as Fetched instead of the default 'OutOfSync'. Setting this to true can save fetch roundtrips to the database to refetch data for the entity already in memory. However setting this setting to true can also cause getting the entity out of sync with the database because another thread has updated the same entity data. Use with care. It's recommended to leave it on its default value: false and only set this to true if you're sure the data in-memory reflects the entity data in the database.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.ScaleOverflowCorrectionActionToUse
member.summary: The action to use when the build-in validation detects a scale overflow (e.g. scale of a field is 2, and the value to set the field to is 10.455, which has a scale of 3). Default is 'Truncate', which means that the overflow value will be truncated to the scale size. If validation is bypassed by setting BuildInValidationBypassMode to a value which makes the build-in validation to be bypassed, this setting has no effect.
member.remarks: You can also set this field by adding a key-value pair to the appSettings section of your application's config file. Use 'scaleOverflowCorrectionActionToUse ' as key and the numeric value of the ScaleOverFlowCorrectionAction enum value as value.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.TransactionCommit
member.summary: When the in which this IEntity2 participates is commited, this IEntity2 can succesfully finish actions performed by this IEntity2. This method is called by , you should not call it by yourself. When this IEntity2 doesn't participate in a transaction it finishes the actions itself, calling this method is not needed.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.TransactionRollback
member.summary: When the in which this IEntity2 participates is rolled back, this IEntity2 has to roll back its internal variables. This method is called by , you should not call it by yourself.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares passed in object with the given object. This is a compare of PK fields. These have to be the same in VALUES. When the values are not the same, or the type is not the same as the current type, false is returned, true otherwise. When this doesn't have any PK fields, all fields are compared. null values are considered as the same value.
member.param: IEntity2 implementing object of the same type as this which will be compared to the PK values of this.
member.returns: True when the PK values of this are the same as the PK values of obj, or when this doesn't have any PK fields, all fields have the same value as obj's fields. False otherwise.
member.remarks: If this entity or the passed in entity is new, no values are compared, but the physical objects are compared (object.Equals()), because new entities can look the same, value wise due to identity fields which are all 0, however which are physical different entities (object wise)

if set to true, the change event is fired if the value is set, if applicable. If set to false, the caller is responsible for calling the change event mechanism, recommended is then: PostFieldValueSetAction()
member.returns: true if the value is actually set, false otherwise.
member.exception: When fieldIndex is smaller than 0 or bigger than the amount of fields in the fields collection.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.RollbackFields(System.String)

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.PerformCustomXmlSerialization(System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor,System.Object,System.Xml.XmlWriter,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.XmlFormatAspect)
member.summary: Performs custom XML serialization for properties which have the CustomXmlSerializationAttribute. Override this method if for some property the data has to be serialized into the output. The xmlwriter should be used to write xml to. You shouldn't emit a startelement with the propertyname, that's already done. Also you shouldn't emit an endelement with the propertyname, that will be done for you. Simply emit XML with the data. Be sure the xml data is valid. You can use the XmlHelper class if necessary.
member.param: The descriptor of the property to serialize.
The property value.
The writer.
The aspects.
member.remarks: Deserialize the value with an override of PerformCustomXmlDeserialization. Adapter specific, Compact25 specific.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.PerformCustomXmlDeserialization(System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Performs custom XML deserialization for properties which have the CustomXmlSerializationAttribute. The xmlreader should be used to read the xml from. The reader is positioned on the StartElement of the property which has the name of the property. Check if the element is empty and if not, read till the reader is positioned on the EndElement of the property (which also has the same name). Your override has to set the property's value, using the descriptor's SetValue method.
member.param: The descriptor of the property to deserialize the value for.
The reader.
member.remarks: Use this method to deserialize a value which was serialized with an override of PerformCustomXmlDeserialization. Adapter specific, Compact25 specific.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.PerformDependencyInjection
member.summary: Performs the dependency injection of related objects. This method will call the Create* methods to create validator, concurrency predicate factory and will then kick in the DependencyInjection functionality build into LLBLGen Pro. This method is called at the end of an entity's InitClassMembers method in the generated code.
member.remarks: If a Validator object is already set for this entity, this method won't set the Validator property to a different object, this to avoid breaking code written for previous versions of LLBLGen Pro.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.OnRequiresTransactionForAuditEntities(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SingleStatementQueryAction)
member.summary: Method which returns true if this auditor expects to have audit entities to persist and therefore needs a transaction. This method is called in the situation when there's no transaction going on though one should be started right before the single-statement action in the case if the auditor has entities to save afterwards. It's recommended to return true if the auditor might have audit entities to persist after an entity save/delete/direct update/direct delete of entities. Default: false
member.param: The single statement action which is about to be started.
member.returns: true if a transaction should be started prior to the action to perform (entity save/delete/direct update/direct delete of entities) false otherwise.
member.remarks: If false is returned and GetAuditEntitiesToSave returns 1 or more entities, a new transaction is started to save these audit entities which means that this transaction isn't re-tryable if this transaction might fail.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.OnAuditEntityFieldGet(System.Int32)
member.summary: Audits when an entity field's value is succesfully obtained from the passed in entity
member.param: Index of the field which value was obtained.
member.remarks: Be careful when using this auditing routine, because a lot of calls will be made to this routine when data is for example shown in a grid. Another thing to realize is that the audit information is stored inside the auditor which is inside an entity which might not be persisted/deleted later on. This means that if you use the audit data to produce entities which are then returned by GetAuditEntitiesToSave are never persisted if the entity this auditor is the auditor of is never persisted/deleted. In that situation, to get reliable journalling, use an external service to log the audit data.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.OnAuditEntityFieldSet(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Audits when an entity field is set succesfully to a new value.
member.param: Index of the field which got a new value.
The original value of the field with the index passed in before it received a new value.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.OnAuditDeleteOfEntity
member.summary: Audits the successful delete of an entity from the database
member.remarks: As the entity passed in was deleted succesfully, reading values from the passed in entity is only possible in this routine. After this call, the state of the entity will be reset to Deleted again and reading the fields will result in an exception. It's also recommended not to reference the passed in entity in any audit entity you might want to persist as the entity doesn't exist anymore in the database.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.OnAuditLoadOfEntity
member.summary: Audits the successful load of an entity from the database
member.remarks: Be careful when using this auditing routine, because the audit information is stored inside the auditor which is inside an entity which might not be persisted/deleted later on. This means that if you use the audit data to produce entities which are then returned by GetAuditEntitiesToSave are never persisted if the entity this auditor is the auditor of is never persisted/deleted. In that situation, to get reliable journalling, use an external service to log the audit data.

member.summary: Method which will validate, using custom code supplied this class, the field with index fieldIndex if it should accept the specified value. member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.UnsetEntitySyncInformation(System.String,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity2,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityRelation)
member.summary: Will unset (remove) the passed in information as Entity sync information. If there is no sync information stored for the related entity after this info has been removed, the complete hashentry is removed.
member.param: Name of field of this entity mapped onto passed in relation
related entity set as value for field with name fieldName
EntityRelation object which is the relation between this entity and the passed in relatedEntity

member.summary: Performs the desetup of the sync info related to the relatedentity passed in
member.param: The related entity.
The properties changed handler.
Name of the field.
The relation.
if set to true [disconnect from save event].

if set to true, it will signal the related entity that it's been dereferenced by calling it's UnsetRelatedEntity method. If the relation is a m:1 relation, the related entity is told not to signal us back IF resetFKFields is false. This is a special case because the 1:n location is in a collection and by telling the related entity not to signal us back, the related entity will use a silent remove on the collection, otherwise the remove is done by the public Remove method which will always signal us back. THe resetFKFields flag signals that this call originates from a location where FK fields are written manually, and the signal back from the related entity will do that again, if performed, hence the special case.
The field in related entity.
if set to true [reset FK fields].
The fk field indexes.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityBase2.CheckIfEntityHasPendingFkSyncs(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Guid,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity2})
member.summary: Checks whether this instance has pending fk syncs. A pending FK sync is a sync which hasn't been used yet. If an entity has pending FK syncs, it has to be included into a save queue. Only syncs with entities in the passed in queue are considered. If a sync is with an entity which isn't in the passed in queue, the sync isn't honoured anyway, so the fk sync can be ignored.
member.param: Hashtable of the entities which are currently scheduled to be saved in the queue. A pending sync has to be with an entity in this queue

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection2.CreateHierarchicalProjection(System.Data.DataSet)

member.summary: Gets the default view for this entitycollection. The returned value is the same instance every time this property is read. It's a new entity view without a filter or a sorter.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection2.ContainsDirtyContents
member.summary: Returns true if this collection contains dirty objects. If this collection contains dirty objects, an already filled collection should not be refreshed until a save is performed.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection2.EntityFactoryToUse
member.summary: The EntityFactory2 to use when creating entity objects when bound to a control and AddNew is enabled.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection2.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Simple indexer.

member.summary: The amount of IEntity2 elements in this entity collection

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection2.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Get / set the readonly flag for this collection.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection2.DirtyEntities
member.summary: Returns a readonly collection of entities which are flagged as dirty. This collection is determined on the fly, you can use this collection to remove dirty entities from this entity collection.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection2.DoNotPerformAddIfPresent
member.summary: When set to true, an entity passed to Add() or Insert() will be tested if it's already present. If so, the index is returned and the object is not added again. If set to false (default: true) this check is not performed. Setting this property to true can slow down fetch logic. DataAccessAdapter's fetch logic sets this property to false during a multi-entity fetch.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection2.ActiveContext
member.summary: Gets / sets the active context this entity collection is in. Setting this property is not adding the entity collection to the context, it will make contained entities be added to the passed in context. If the entity collection is already in a context, setting this property has no effect. Setting this property is done by framework code, use the Context's Add/Get methods to work with contexts and entity collections.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection2.ConcurrencyPredicateFactoryToUse
member.summary: Gets / sets the IConcurrencyPredicateFactory instance to use when creating entity objects during an entity collection fetch

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection2.AllowNew
member.summary: Default: true. If set to false, no new entities will be added through databinding.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection2.AllowRemove
member.summary: Default: false. If set to true, entities can be removed through databinding.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection2.AllowEdit
member.summary: Default: true. If set to false, entities inside this collection won't be editable in a complex databinding scenario.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection2.Capacity
member.summary: Gets / sets the initial capacity of the entity collection.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection2.RemovedEntitiesTracker
member.summary: Gets or sets the entity collection which should be used as removed entities tracker. If this property is set to an IEntityCollection2 instance, all entities which are removed from this collection are marked for deletion and placed in this removed entities tracker collection. This collection can then later on be used to delete these entities from the database in one go.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollectionAccess2.EntityCollection2Xml(System.String,System.Xml.XmlWriter,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Guid,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity2},SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.XmlFormatAspect,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Produces the actual XML for this entity collection, recursively. Because it recurses through contained entities, it keeps track of which objects are processed so cyclic references are not resulting in cyclic recursion and thus a crash.
member.param: name of root element to use when building a complete XML representation of this entity collection.
The writer to write the output to.

Hashtable with ObjectIDs of all the objects already processed. If an entity's ObjectID is in the hashtable's key list, a ProcessedObjectReference tag is emitted and the entity will not recurse further.
The aspect flags to control the format of the XML produced
if set to true, the XML will contain the factory name, otherwise it won't. Used in Compact25 format
if set to true, the start element produced is the absolute root element of the xml to produce.

member.summary: Performs the actual conversion from Xml to entity collection data.
member.param: current node which points to an entity collection node.

member.summary: Performs the actual conversion from Xml to entity collection data.

The writer to write the output to.

The aspect flags to control the format of the XML produced
if set to true, the XML will contain the factory name, otherwise it won't. Used in Compact25 format
if set to true, the start element produced is the absolute root element of the xml to produce.

member.summary: Creates a hierarchical projection of all the data in this collection and for each type in the complete graph found starting with each entity in this collection, using the collectionProjections data passed in. Per entity type found, a new datatable is created inside destination.

The destination dataset in which the projection result is stored. Each DataTable has the name of the entity contained, e.g. "CustomerEntity". DataRelations are created between the data if applicable.
member.remarks: destination is cleared before a projection is performed.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase2`1.EntityFactoryToUse
member.summary: The EntityFactory2 to use when creating entity objects when bound to a grid and AddNew is enabled.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase2`1.ActiveContext
member.summary: Gets / sets the active context this entity collection is in. Setting this property is not adding the entity collection to the context, it will make contained entities be added to the passed in context. If the entity collection is already in a context, setting this property has no effect. Setting this property is done by framework code, use the Context's Add/Get methods to work with contexts and entity collections.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase2`1.ContainsDirtyContents
member.summary: Returns true if this collection contains dirty objects. If this collection contains dirty objects, an already filled collection should not be refreshed until a save is performed. This property is calculated in real time and can be time consuming when the collection contains a lot of objects. Use this property only in cases when the value of this property is used to do a refetch or not.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase2`1.DefaultView
member.summary: Gets the default view for this entitycollection. The returned value is the same instance every time this property is read. It's an entity view without a filter or a sorter.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase2`1.RemovedEntitiesTracker
member.summary: Gets or sets the entity collection which should be used as removed entities tracker. If this property is set to an IEntityCollection2 instance, all entities which are removed from this collection are marked for deletion and placed in this removed entities tracker collection. This collection can then later on be used to delete these entities from the database in one go.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase2`1.CachedPkHashes
member.summary: Gets / sets the CachedPkHashes. This is a dictionary with the PK hashes for the entities in this collection. This is set during a prefetch path fetch, to cache already calculated PK side hashes.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.SaveMulti
member.summary: Saves all new/dirty Entities in the IEntityCollection in the persistent storage. If this IEntityCollection is added to a transaction, the save processes will be done in that transaction, if the entity isn't already added to another transaction. If the entity is already in another transaction, it will use that transaction. If no transaction is present, the saves are done in a new Transaction (which is created in an inherited method.). Will not recursively save entities inside the collection.
member.returns: Amount of entities inserted
member.remarks: All exceptions will be bubbled upwards so transaction code can anticipate on exceptions.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.SaveMulti(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves all new/dirty Entities in the IEntityCollection in the persistent storage. If this IEntityCollection is added to a transaction, the save processes will be done in that transaction, if the entity isn't already added to another transaction. If the entity is already in another transaction, it will use that transaction. If no transaction is present, the saves are done in a new Transaction (which is created in an inherited method.)
member.param: If true, will recursively save the entities inside the collection
member.returns: Amount of entities inserted
member.remarks: All exceptions will be bubbled upwards so transaction code can anticipate on exceptions.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.DeleteMulti
member.summary: Deletes all Entities in the IEntityCollection from the persistent storage. If this IEntityCollection is added to a transaction, the delete processes will be done in that transaction, if the entity isn't already added to another transaction. If the entity is already in another transaction, it will use that transaction. If no transaction is present, the deletes are done in a new Transaction (which is created in an inherited method.) Deleted entities are marked deleted and are removed from the collection.
member.returns: Amount of entities deleted
member.remarks: All exceptions will be bubbled upwards so transaction code can anticipate on exceptions.

member.summary: Will fill the entity collection and its containing members (recursively) with the data stored in the XmlNode passed in. member.param: string with Xml data which should be read into this entity collection and its members. This string has to be in the correct format and should be loadable into a new XmlDocument without problems

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.CreateHierarchicalProjection(System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary: Creates a hierarchical projection of all the data in this collection and for each type in the complete graph found starting with each entity in this collection. Per entity type found, a new datatable is created inside destination. It will simply project every data element.
member.param: The destination dataset in which the projection result is stored. Each DataTable has the name of the entity contained, e.g. "CustomerEntity". DataRelations are created between the data if applicable.
member.remarks: destination is cleared before a projection is performed.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.CreateHierarchicalProjection(System.Collections.Generic.List{SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IViewProjectionData},System.Data.DataSet)

member.param: The projection data per entity type
The destination dataset in which the projection result is stored. Each DataTable has the name of the entity contained, e.g. "CustomerEntity". DataRelations are created between the data if applicable.
member.remarks: destination is cleared before a projection is performed.

member.remarks: destination is cleared before a projection is performed.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.FetchExcludedFields(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ExcludeIncludeFieldsList)
member.summary: Loads the data for the excluded fields specified in the list of excluded fields into all the entities in this collection.
member.param: The excludedIncludedFields object as it is used when fetching the passed in collection. If you used the excludedIncludedFields object to fetch only the fields in that list (i.e. excludedIncludedFields.ExcludeContainedFields==false), the routine will fetch all other fields in the resultset for the entities in the collection excluding the fields in excludedIncludedFields.
member.remarks: The field data is set like a normal field value set, so authorization is applied to it. This routine batches fetches to have at most 5*DaoBase.ParameterisedPrefetchPathThreshold of parameters per fetch. Keep in mind that most databases have a limit on the # of parameters per query.

member.name: E:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.EntityRemoving

member.name: E:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.EntityRemoved

member.name: E:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.EntityAdded

member.name: E:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.ListChanged
member.summary: Event which is raised when the collection changed: an item changed, an item was removed, added, or the collection was cleared. If possible, use one of the Entity* events of this collection.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.DefaultView
member.summary: Gets the default view for this entitycollection. The returned value is the same instance every time this property is read. It's a new entity view without a filter or a sorter.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.DirtyEntities
member.summary: Returns a readonly collection of entities which are flagged as dirty. This collection is determined on the fly, you can use this collection to remove dirty entities from this entity collection.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.MaxNumberOfItemsToReturn
member.summary: The maximum number of items to return with this retrieval query. If the used Dynamic Query Engine supports it, 'TOP' is used to limit the amount of rows to return. When set to 0, no limitations are specified.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.SortClauses
member.summary: The order by specifications for the sorting of the resultset. When not specified, no sorting is applied.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.ContainsDirtyContents
member.summary: Returns true if this collection contains dirty objects. If this collection contains dirty objects, an already filled collection should not be refreshed until a save is performed. This property is calculated in real time and can be time consuming when the collection contains a lot of objects. Use this property only in cases when the value of this property is used to do a refetch or not.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.EntityFactoryToUse
member.summary: The EntityFactory to use when creating entity objects during a GetMulti() call or other logic which requires the creation of new entities.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.SuppressClearInGetMulti
member.summary: Surpresses the removal of all contents of the collection in a GetMulti*() call. Used by code in related entities to prevent the removal of objects when collection properties are accessed.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.Count
member.summary: The amount of IEntity elements in this entity collection

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.ActiveContext
member.summary: Gets / sets the active context this entity collection is in. Setting this property is not adding the entity collection to the context, it will make contained entities be added to the passed in context. If the entity collection is already in a context, setting this property has no effect. Setting this property is done by framework code, use the Context's Add/Get methods to work with contexts and entity collections.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.ConcurrencyPredicateFactoryToUse
member.summary: Gets / sets the IConcurrencyPredicateFactory instance to use when creating entity objects during a GetMulti() call or when AddNew is called.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the at the specified index.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.AllowNew
member.summary: Default: true. If set to false, no new entities will be added through databinding.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.AllowRemove
member.summary: Default: false. If set to true, entities can be removed through databinding.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.AllowEdit
member.summary: Default: true. If set to false, entities inside this collection won't be editable in a complex databinding scenario.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Get / set the readonly flag for this collection.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.DoNotPerformAddIfPresent
member.summary: When set to true, an entity passed to Add() or Insert() will be tested if it's already present. If so, the index is returned and the object is not added again. If set to false (default: true) this check is not performed. Setting this property to true can slow down fetch logic. DataAccessAdapter's fetch logic sets this property to false during a multi-entity fetch.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.Capacity
member.summary: Gets / sets the initial capacity of the entity collection.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollection.RemovedEntitiesTracker
member.summary: Gets or sets the entity collection which should be used as removed entities tracker. If this property is set to an IEntityCollection2 instance, all entities which are removed from this collection are marked for deletion and placed in this removed entities tracker collection. This collection can then later on be used to delete these entities from the database in one go.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollectionAccess
member.summary: Internal interface for entity collection method access when the type of the collection isn't known.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollectionAccess.EntityCollection2Xml(System.String,System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Guid,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity},SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.XmlFormatAspect,System.Xml.XmlNode@)
member.summary: Produces the actual XML for this entity collection, recursively. Because it recurses through contained entities, it keeps track of which objects are processed so cyclic references are not resulting in cyclic recursion and thus a crash.
member.param: name of root element to use when building a complete XML representation of this entity collection.
the XmlDocument which will contain the node this method will create. This document is required to create the new node object

Hashtable with ObjectIDs of all the objects already processed. If an entity's ObjectID is in the hashtable's key list, a ProcessedObjectReference tag is emitted and the entity will not recurse further.
The aspect flags to control the format of the XML produced
The XmlNode representing this complete entitycollection object, including containing data.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCollectionAccess.Xml2EntityCollection(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Guid,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity},System.Collections.Generic.List{SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.NodeEntityReference})
member.summary: Performs the actual conversion from Xml to entity collection data.
member.param: current node which points to an entity collection node.
ObjectID's of all entities instantiated
list with all the references to entity objects we probably do not yet have instantiated. This list is traversed after the xml tree has been processed. (not done by this routine, but by the caller)

The list of IEntityField objects which have to be excluded or included for the fetch. If null or empty, all fields are fetched (default). member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.TransactionCommit
member.summary: When the in which this IEntity participates is commited, this IEntity can succesfully finish actions performed by this IEntity. This method is called by , you should not call it by yourself. When this IEntity doesn't participate in a transaction it finishes the actions itself, calling this method is not needed.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.TransactionRollback
member.summary: When the in which this IEntity participates is rolled back, this IEntity has to roll back its internal variables. This method is called by , you should not call it by yourself.

member.param: The destination dataset in which the projection result is stored. Each DataTable has the name of the entity contained, e.g. "CustomerEntity". DataRelations are created between the data if applicable.
member.remarks: destination is cleared before a projection is performed.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.SaveMulti
member.summary: Saves all new/dirty Entities in the IEntityCollection in the persistent storage. If this IEntityCollection is added to a transaction, the save processes will be done in that transaction, if the entity isn't already added to another transaction. If the entity is already in another transaction, it will use that transaction. If no transaction is present, the saves are done in a new Transaction (which is created in an inherited method.). Will not recursively save entities inside the collection.
member.returns: Amount of entities inserted
member.remarks: All exceptions will be bubbled upwards so transaction code can anticipate on exceptions.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.SaveMulti(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves all new/dirty Entities in the IEntityCollection in the persistent storage. If this IEntityCollection is added to a transaction, the save processes will be done in that transaction, if the entity isn't already added to another transaction. If the entity is already in another transaction, it will use that transaction. If no transaction is present, the saves are done in a new Transaction (which is created in an inherited method.)
member.param: If true, will recursively save the entities inside the collection
member.returns: Amount of entities inserted
member.remarks: All exceptions will be bubbled upwards so transaction code can anticipate on exceptions.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.DeleteMulti
member.summary: Deletes all Entities in the IEntityCollection from the persistent storage. If this IEntityCollection is added to a transaction, the delete processes will be done in that transaction, if the entity isn't already added to another transaction. If the entity is already in another transaction, it will use that transaction. If no transaction is present, the deletes are done in a/ new Transaction. Deleted entities are marked deleted and are removed from the collection.
member.returns: Amount of entities deleted

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.DeleteMulti(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPredicate)
member.summary: Deletes from the persistent storage all entities of the type this collection is for which match with the specified filter, formulated in the predicate or predicate expression definition.
member.param: A predicate or predicate expression which should be used as filter for the entities to delete. Can be null, which will result in a query removing all entities of the type this collection is for from the persistent storage
member.returns: Amount of entities affected, if the used persistent storage has rowcounting enabled.
member.remarks: Not supported for entities which are in a hierarchy of TargetPerEntity

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.DeleteMulti(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPredicate,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRelationCollection)
member.summary: Deletes from the persistent storage all entities of the type this collection is for which match with the specified filter, formulated in the predicate or predicate expression definition.

The set of relations to walk to construct the total query.
member.remarks: Not supported for entities which are in a hierarchy of TargetPerEntity

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.UpdateMulti(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPredicate)
member.summary: Updates in the persistent storage all entities of the type this collection is for which have data in common with the specified entity. Which fields are updated in those matching entities depends on which fields are changed in entityWithNewValues. The new values of these fields are read from entityWithNewValues.
member.param: entity instance which holds the new values for the matching entities to update. Only changed fields are taken into account
A predicate or predicate expression which should be used as filter for the entities to update. Can be null, which will result in an update action which will affect all Customer entities.
member.returns: Amount of entities affected, if the used persistent storage has rowcounting enabled.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.UpdateMulti(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntity,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPredicate,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRelationCollection)

member.param: entity instance which holds the new values for the matching entities to update. Only changed fields are taken into account
A predicate or predicate expression which should be used as filter for the entities to update.
The set of relations to walk to construct the total query.
member.returns: Amount of entities affected, if the used persistent storage has rowcounting enabled.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.FetchExcludedFields(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ExcludeIncludeFieldsList)
member.summary: Loads the data for the excluded fields specified in the list of excluded fields into all the entities in this collection.
member.param: The excludedIncludedFields object as it is used when fetching the entity. If you used the excludedIncludedFields object to fetch only the fields in that list (i.e. excludedIncludedFields.ExcludeContainedFields==false), the routine will fetch all other fields in the resultset for the entities in the collection excluding the fields in excludedIncludedFields.
member.remarks: The field data is set like a normal field value set, so authorization is applied to it. This routine batches fetches to have at most 5*DaoBase.ParameterisedPrefetchPathThreshold of parameters per fetch. Keep in mind that most databases have a limit on the # of parameters per query.

member.summary: Retrieves in this Collection object all Entity objects which match with the specified filter, formulated in the predicate or predicate expression definition, using the passed in relations to construct the total query.
member.param: A predicate or predicate expression which should be used as filter for the entities to retrieve.
The maximum number of items to return with this retrieval query.
The order by specifications for the sorting of the resultset. When not specified, no sorting is applied.
The set of relations to walk to construct the total query.

The list of IEntityField objects which have to be excluded or included for the fetch. If null or empty, all fields are fetched (default). If an instance of ExcludeIncludeFieldsList is passed in and its ExcludeContainedFields property is set to false, the fields contained in excludedIncludedFields are kept in the query, the rest of the fields in the query are excluded.
The page number to retrieve.
The page size of the page to retrieve.
member.returns: true if succeeded, false otherwise
member.remarks: special version which is used by prefetch path code, and which modifies the relation collection and filter for hierarchical fetches

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.PerformSaveMulti(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves all new/dirty Entities in the IEntityCollection in the persistent storage. If this IEntityCollection is added to a transaction, the save processes will be done in that transaction, if the entity isn't already added to another transaction. If the entity is already in another transaction, it will use that transaction. If no transaction is present, the saves are done in a new Transaction (which is created in an inherited method.)
member.param: If true, will recursively save the entities inside the collection
member.returns: Amount of entities inserted
member.remarks: All exceptions will be bubbled upwards so transaction code can anticipate on exceptions.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.PerformDeleteMulti
member.summary: Deletes all Entities in the IEntityCollection from the persistent storage. If this IEntityCollection is added to a transaction, the delete processes will be done in that transaction, if the entity isn't already added to another transaction. If the entity is already in another transaction, it will use that transaction. If no transaction is present, the deletes are done in a new Transaction (which is created in an inherited method.) Deleted entities are marked deleted and are removed from the collection.
member.returns: Amount of entities deleted
member.remarks: All exceptions will be bubbled upwards so transaction code can anticipate on exceptions.

member.param: Writer to which the xml is written to
member.remarks: Uses XmlFormatAspect.Compact | XmlFormatAspect.MLTextInCDataBlocks | XmlFormatAspect.DatesInXmlDataType.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.GetSchema
member.summary: Produce the schema, always return null, as the XmlSerializer object otherwise can't handle our code.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.ReadXml(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Constructs an object graph with this object as the root from the xml contained by the passed in XmlReader object.
member.param: Reader with xml used to produce an object graph
member.remarks: Uses XmlFormatAspect.Compact | XmlFormatAspect.MLTextInCDataBlocks | XmlFormatAspect.DatesInXmlDataType. Xml data should have been produced with WriteXml(writer) or a similar routine which is able to produce similar formatted XML

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.SD#LLBLGen#Pro#ORMSupportClasses#ICollectionMaintenance#SurpressListChangedEvents
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [surpress list changed events].
member.value: true if [surpress list changed events]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.SD#LLBLGen#Pro#ORMSupportClasses#ICollectionMaintenance#DeserializationInProgress
member.summary: Gets / sets the DeserializationInProgress flag.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.SD#LLBLGen#Pro#ORMSupportClasses#IEntityCollection#DirtyEntities
member.summary: Returns a readonly collection of entities which are flagged as dirty. This collection is determined on the fly, you can use this collection to remove dirty entities from this entity collection.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.SD#LLBLGen#Pro#ORMSupportClasses#IEntityCollection#Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the at the specified index.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.SD#LLBLGen#Pro#ORMSupportClasses#IEntityCollection#DefaultView
member.summary: Gets the default view for this entitycollection. The returned value is a new instance every time this property is read. It's a new entity view without a filter or a sorter.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.SD#LLBLGen#Pro#ORMSupportClasses#IEntityCollection#Capacity
member.summary: Gets / sets the initial capacity of the entity collection.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.ContainsListCollection
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the collection is a collection of objects.
member.returns: true if the collection is a collection of objects; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.Transaction
member.summary: The this ITransactionalElement implementing object is participating in. Only valid if is true. If set to null, the ITransactionalElement is no longer participating in a transaction.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.ParticipatesInTransaction
member.summary: Flag to check if the ITransactionalElement implementing object is participating in a transaction or not.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.MaxNumberOfItemsToReturn
member.summary: The maximum number of items to return with this retrieval query. If the used Dynamic Query Engine supports it, 'TOP' is used to limit the amount of rows to return. When set to 0, no limitations are specified.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.SortClauses
member.summary: The order by specifications for the sorting of the resultset when fetching it from the persistent storage. When not specified, no sorting is applied.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.ContainsDirtyContents
member.summary: Returns true if this collection contains dirty objects. If this collection contains dirty objects, an already filled collection should not be refreshed until a save is performed. This property is calculated in real time and can be time consuming when the collection contains a lot of objects. Use this property only in cases when the value of this property is used to do a refetch or not.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.SuppressClearInGetMulti
member.summary: Surpresses the removal of all contents of the collection in a GetMulti*() call. Used by code in related entities to prevent the removal of objects when collection properties are accessed.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.ActiveContext
member.summary: Gets / sets the active context this entity collection is in. Setting this property is not adding the entity collection to the context, it will make contained entities be added to the passed in context. If the entity collection is already in a context, setting this property has no effect. Setting this property is done by framework code, use the Context's Add/Get methods to work with contexts and entity collections.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.EntityFactoryToUse
member.summary: The EntityFactory to use when creating entity objects during a GetMulti() call or other logic which requires the creation of new entities.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.DefaultView
member.summary: Gets the default view for this entitycollection. The returned value is the same instance every time this property is read. It's an entity view without a filter or a sorter.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.RemovedEntitiesTracker
member.summary: Gets or sets the entity collection which should be used as removed entities tracker. If this property is set to an IEntityCollection instance, all entities which are removed from this collection are marked for deletion and placed in this removed entities tracker collection. This collection can then later on be used to delete these entities from the database in one go.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityCollectionBase`1.CachedPkHashes
member.summary: Gets / sets the CachedPkHashes. This is a dictionary with the PK hashes for the entities in this collection. This is set during a prefetch path fetch, to cache already calculated PK side hashes.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityFactoryCore
member.summary: Abstract base class for entity factories. The class is suffixed with 'Core' as the generated code contains another base class, EntityFactoryBase, which is the direct base class for the generated entity factories.
member.remarks: SelfServicing specific

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFactory

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFactoryCore

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField
member.summary: Generic class which is used for the columns in the EntityFields collection, which forms the data store of any Entity class generated by LLBLGen Pro.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityField
member.summary: Interface for the EntityField type. An EntityField is the unit which is used to hold the value for a given property of an entity. SelfServicing specific.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFieldCore
member.summary: Interface definition which defines the core IEntityField set. Is implemented by other interfaces like IEntityField and IEntityField2. Generic.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldInfo
member.summary: General interface for static entity field information and isn't related to persistence info.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldInfo.Name
member.summary: The name of the field. Name cannot be of zero length nor can they consist of solely spaces. Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed.
member.exception: The value specified for Name is invalid.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldInfo.DataType
member.summary: The of the values of this field.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldInfo.IsPrimaryKey
member.summary: If set to true, in the constructor, this field will end up in the PrimaryKey field list of the containing IEntityFields object.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldInfo.IsNullable
member.summary: Will be true if this field can be set to NULL in the database, false otherwise. The Field Validation logic in an entity will use this flag to check if the field indeed can be set to NULL or not. Set by constructor.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldInfo.FieldIndex
member.summary: Gets the field index related to this IEntityField, so the field can be used to retrieve the field index.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldInfo.ContainingObjectName
member.summary: Name of the containing object this field belongs to (entity or typed view). This name is required to retrieve persistence information in Adapter Set via constructor. This name is also used by EntityRelation to determine alias - table connection.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldInfo.IsForeignKey
member.summary: If set to true, in the constructor, this field is part of a foreign key. This field is not used in LLBLGen Pro's code, however can be useful in user code.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldInfo.IsReadOnly
member.summary: If set to true, in the constructor, no changes can be made to this field.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldInfo.MaxLength
member.summary: The maximum length of the value of the entityfield (string/binary data). Is ignored for entityfields which hold non-string and non-binary values. Value initially set for this field is the length of the database column this field is mapped on.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldInfo.Scale
member.summary: The scale of the value for this field. Value initially set for this field is the scale of the database column this field is mapped on.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldInfo.Precision
member.summary: The precision of the value for this field. Value initially set for this field is the precision of the database column this field is mapped on.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldInfo.ActualContainingObjectName
member.summary: The name of the object this field is currently in. Differs only from ContainingObjectName if the field instance is in a subtype while it is originally defined in a supertype.
member.example: EmployeeEntity.Name and a subtype, ClerkEntity, inherits this field. For ClerkEntity.Name ContainingObjectName is still 'EmployeeEntity' however ActualContainingObjectName is 'ClerkEntity'.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldInfo.IsInMultiTargetEntity
member.summary: Flag to signal if the field is in a multi-target entity. Used for alias production during query building in scenario's with inheritance.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFieldCore.ForcedCurrentValueWrite(System.Object)
member.summary: Overwrites the current value with the value passed. This bypasses value checking and field properties like readonly. Used by internal code only. Do not call this from your code.
member.param: Value to store as the current value

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFieldCore.ForcedCurrentValueWrite(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Overwrites the current value with the value passed. This bypasses value checking and field properties like readonly. Used by internal code only. Do not call this from your code.
member.param: Value to store as the current value
the value read from the database.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFieldCore.GetHashCode
member.summary: Overrides the GetHashCode() method. It will return the hashcode of the value of the field as the hashcode.
member.returns: hashcode of the value of the field.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFieldCore.GetDiscriminatorColumnFlag
member.summary: Gets the discriminator column flag.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFieldCore.Alias
member.summary: The alias to use for this field. Only used when this field object is part of a typed list. Adapter: returns the alias set in the designer SelfServicing: returns Name

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFieldCore.CurrentValue
member.summary: Gets the current value for this field and sets the new value for this field, by overwriting current value. The value in currentValue is discarded, versioning control has to save the original value of currentValue before this property is called.
member.remarks: Calling this property directly will not trigger versioning control, thus calling this property directly is not recommended. Call instead. Type of the new value has to be the same as IFieldInfo.DataType, which is set in the constructor. If this field is set to readonly, an exception is raised.
member.exception: The field is set to readonly and can't be changed.
The value specified is not of the same IFieldInfo.DataType as this field.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFieldCore.DbValue
member.summary: Gets the value read from the database for this field. Use this field in optimistic concurrency predicates. Set by ForcedCurrentValueWrite(object, value) by the object fetcher logic.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFieldCore.IsChanged
member.summary: If the value of this field is changed, this property is set to true. Set when receives a valid value.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFieldCore.IsNull
member.summary: If the original value in the column for this entityfield is DBNull (NULL), this parameter should be set to true, otherwise to false. In BL Logic, it's impractical to work with NULL values, so these are converted to handable values. The developer can still determine if the original value was DBNull by checking this field. Using NULL values is not recommended. If is false, IsNull is undefined.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFieldCore.ObjectAlias
member.summary: Alias for the object containing the field this entity field is mapped on. Used in typed list selection lists.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFieldCore.AggregateFunctionToApply
member.summary: The aggregate function to apply on this field in a select query. Ignored in INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE queries. Designed to be used in TypedList/TypedView classes.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFieldCore.ExpressionToApply
member.summary: The expression to apply to this field in a select list, update statement or predicate or expression. Expression is applied before AggregateFunctionToApply.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFieldCore.LinkedSuperTypeField
member.summary: Gets / sets linkedSuperTypeField. Fields of PK/UC's are linked with eachother in a target-per-entity hierarchy. This is managed in the EntityFields(2) object.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldPersistenceInfo
member.summary: Interface which holds the generic information for entity field persistence of an entity field. Instances of this interface are passed to logic with an instance of the IEntityFieldCore interface. SelfServicing implements both interfaces in one interface: IEntityField. Generic

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldPersistenceInfo.SourceCatalogName
member.summary: The name of the catalog the SourceSchemaName is located in.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldPersistenceInfo.SourceSchemaName
member.summary: The name of the schema which holds . Schema is used to generate SQL on the fly. A common schema name in SqlServer is f.e. 'dbo'.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldPersistenceInfo.SourceObjectName
member.summary: The name of the source object which holds . Can be a view or a table (or synonym of those). Used to generate SQL on the fly.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldPersistenceInfo.SourceColumnName
member.summary: The name of the corresponding column in a view or table for an entityfield. This name is used to map a column in a resultset onto the entity field.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldPersistenceInfo.SourceColumnMaxLength
member.summary: The maximum length of the value of the entityfield (string/binary data). Is ignored for entityfields which hold non-string and non-binary values. ColumnMaxLength Used for update/insert operations on the column

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldPersistenceInfo.SourceColumnDbType
member.summary: The type of the Column mapped onto the EntityField. The value stored here is the integer representation of the enum value of the type, f.e. SqlDbType.Int or OracleType.Int16 Used for update/insert operations on the column

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldPersistenceInfo.SourceColumnIsNullable
member.summary: Flag if the Column mapped onto the entityfield is nullable or not. Used for update/insert operations on the column

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldPersistenceInfo.SourceColumnScale
member.summary: The scale of the Column mapped onto the entityfield. Used for update/insert operations on the column

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldPersistenceInfo.SourceColumnPrecision
member.summary: The precision of the Column mapped onto the entityfield. Used for update/insert operations on the column

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldPersistenceInfo.IsIdentity
member.summary: If set to true, the Dynamic Query Engine (DQE) will assume the field is an Identity field and will act accordingly (i.e.: as the target database handles Identity fields: SqlServer will generate a new value itself, Oracle wants to have a sequence input.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldPersistenceInfo.IdentityValueSequenceName
member.summary: If is set to true, this property has to be set to the name of the sequence which supplies the value for the EntityField's corresponding table field. On SqlServer this is @@IDENTITY or SCOPE_IDENTITY() and only used when the row is succesfully inserted, however on Oracle this value is used to specify a new value and to retrieve the new value. Is undefined when is set to false.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldPersistenceInfo.TypeConverterToUse
member.summary: Gets the type converter to use. Only set through constructor and when a conversion is required from the .NET type returned by the ADO.NET provider and the defined .NET type for this field.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IFieldPersistenceInfo.ActualDotNetType
member.summary: The .NET type of the field in the DB. This value is used to convert a currentvalue back to this type using TypeConverterToUse.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the given entityfield instance with this instance using a value compare with case sensitive comparer logic. this is done by comparing the name, the source schema, object and column name. If there is any mismatch, the comparisson is stopped and the result of the mismatching compare is returned.
member.param: The EntityField to compare with the current value.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer that indicates the relative order of the comparands. See .

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.SourceObjectName
member.summary: The name of the source object which holds . Can be a view or a table. Used to generate SQL on the fly.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.SourceColumnName
member.summary: The name of the corresponding column in a view or table for this entityfield. This name is used to map a column in a resultset onto the entity field. Used for update/insert operations on the column

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.SourceColumnMaxLength
member.summary: The maximum length of the value of this entityfield (string/binary data). Is ignored for entityfields which hold non-string and non-binary values. ColumnMaxLength Used for update/insert operations on the column

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.SourceColumnDbType
member.summary: The type of the Column mapped onto the EntityField. The value stored here is the integer representation of the enum value of the type, f.e. SqlDbType.Int or OracleType.Int16 Used for update/insert operations on the column

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.SourceColumnIsNullable
member.summary: Flag if the Column mapped onto the entityfield is nullable or not. Used for update/insert operations on the column

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.SourceColumnScale
member.summary: The scale of the Column mapped onto the entityfield. Used for update/insert operations on the column

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.SourceColumnPrecision
member.summary: The precision of the Column mapped onto the entityfield. Used for update/insert operations on the column

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.Name
member.summary: The name of the field.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.Alias
member.summary: The alias to use for this field. By default the same as the entity name.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.OriginalValue
member.summary: The original value for this field when the field is changed and the change has not been accepted yet.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.CurrentValue
member.summary: Gets the current value for this field and sets the new value for this field, by overwriting current value. The value in currentValue is discarded, versioning control has to save the original value of currentValue before this property is called.
member.remarks: Calling this property directly will not trigger versioning control, thus calling this property directly is not recommended. Call instead. Type of the new value has to be the same as , which is set in the constructor. If this field is set to readonly, an exception is raised.
member.exception: The field is set to readonly and can't be changed.
The value specified is not of the same as this field.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.DataType
member.summary: The of the values of this field.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.IsReadOnly
member.summary: If set to true, in the constructor, no changes can be made to this field.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.IsPrimaryKey
member.summary: If set to true, in the constructor, this field will end up in the PrimaryKey field list of the containing IEntityFields object.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.IsChanged
member.summary: If the value of this field is changed, this property is set to true. Set when receives a valid value. Set to false when is called succesfully.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.IsNullable
member.summary: Will be true if this field can be set to NULL in the database, false otherwise. The Field Validation logic in an entity will use this flag to check if the field indeed can be set to NULL or not. For selfservicing entities, this flag returns the same value as SourceColumnIsNullable.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.IsNull
member.summary: If the original value in the column for this entityfield is DBNull (NULL), this parameter should be set to true, otherwise to false. In BL Logic, it's impractical to work with NULL values, so these are converted to workable values. The developer can still determine if the original value was DBNull by checking this field. Using NULL values is not recommended.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.IsIdentity
member.summary: If set to true, the Dynamic Query Engine (DQE) will assume the field is an Identity field and will act accordingly (i.e.: as the target database handles Identity fields: SqlServer will generate a new value itself, Oracle wants to have a sequence input.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.IdentityValueSequenceName
member.summary: If is set to true, this property has to be set to the name of the sequence which supplies the value for the EntityField's corresponding table field. On SqlServer this is @@IDENTITY or SCOPE_IDENTITY() and only used when the row is succesfully inserted, however on Oracle f.e. this value is used to specify a new value and to retrieve the new value. Is undefined when is set to false.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.FieldIndex
member.summary: Gets the field index related to this IEntityField, so the field can be used to retrieve the field index.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.DbValue
member.summary: Gets the value read from the database for this field. Use this field in optimistic concurrency predicates. Set by ForcedCurrentValueWrite(object, value) by the object fetcher logic.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.ContainingObjectName
member.summary: Name of the containing object this field belongs to (entity or typed view). This name is required to retrieve persistence information in Adapter Set via constructor. This name is also used by EntityRelation to determine alias - table connection.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.ObjectAlias
member.summary: Alias for the object containing the field this entity field is mapped on. Used in typed list selection lists.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.AggregateFunctionToApply
member.summary: The aggregate function to apply on this field in a select query. Ignored in INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE queries. Designed to be used in TypedList/TypedView classes.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.ExpressionToApply
member.summary: The expression to apply to this field in a select list, update statement or predicate. Expression is applied before AggregateFunctionToApply.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.IsForeignKey
member.summary: If set to true, in the constructor, this field is part of a foreign key. This field is not used in LLBLGen Pro's code, however can be useful in user code.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.TypeConverterToUse
member.summary: Gets the type converter to use. Only set through constructor and when a conversion is required from the .NET type returned by the ADO.NET provider and the defined .NET type for this field.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.MaxLength
member.summary: The maximum length of the value of the entityfield (string/binary data). Is ignored for entityfields which hold non-string and non-binary values. Value initially set for this field is the length of the database column this field is mapped on.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.Scale
member.summary: The scale of the value for this field. Value initially set for this field is the scale of the database column this field is mapped on.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.Precision
member.summary: The precision of the value for this field. Value initially set for this field is the precision of the database column this field is mapped on.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.ActualContainingObjectName
member.summary: The name of the object this field is currently in. Differs only from ContainingObjectName if the field instance is in a subtype while it is originally defined in a supertype.
member.example: EmployeeEntity.Name and a subtype, ClerkEntity, inherits this field. For ClerkEntity.Name ContainingObjectName is still 'EmployeeEntity' however ActualContainingObjectName is 'ClerkEntity'.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField.IsInMultiTargetEntity
member.summary: Flag to signal if the field is in a multi-target entity. Used for alias production during query building in scenario's with inheritance.
