member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.LinkedSuperTypeField
member.summary: Gets / sets linkedSuperTypeField. Fields of PK/UC's are linked with eachother in a target-per-entity hierarchy. This is managed in the EntityFields object.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.LinkedSubTypeFields
member.summary: Gets linkedSubTypeFields

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.MaxLength
member.summary: The maximum length of the value of the entityfield (string/binary data). Is ignored for entityfields which hold non-string and non-binary values. Value initially set for this field is the length of the database column this field is mapped on.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.Scale
member.summary: The scale of the value for this field. Value initially set for this field is the scale of the database column this field is mapped on.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.Precision
member.summary: The precision of the value for this field. Value initially set for this field is the precision of the database column this field is mapped on.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.Name
member.summary: The name of the field. Used in XML output.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.Alias
member.summary: The alias to use for this field. By default the same as the entity name.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.OriginalValue
member.summary: The original value for this field when the field is changed and the change has not been accepted yet.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.CurrentValue
member.summary: Gets the current value for this field and sets the new value for this field, by overwriting current value. The value in currentValue is discarded, versioning control has to save the original value of currentValue before this property is called.
member.remarks: Calling this property directly will not trigger versioning control, thus calling this property directly is not recommended. Call instead. Type of the new value has to be the same as , which is set in the constructor. If this field is set to readonly, an exception is raised.
member.exception: The field is set to readonly and not part of the PK.
The value specified is not of the same as this field.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.DataType
member.summary: The of the values of this field.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.IsPrimaryKey
member.summary: If set to true, in the constructor, this field will end up in the PrimaryKey field list of the containing IEntityFields object.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.IsReadOnly
member.summary: If set to true, in the constructor, no changes can be made to this field.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.IsChanged
member.summary: If the value of this field is changed, this property is set to true. Set when receives a valid value. Set to false when is called succesfully.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.IsNull
member.summary: If the original value in the column for this entityfield is DBNull (NULL), this parameter should be set to true, otherwise to false. In BL Logic, it's impractical to work with NULL values, so these are converted to workable values. The developer can still determine if the original value was DBNull by checking this field. Using NULL values is not recommended.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.FieldIndex
member.summary: Gets the field index related to this IEntityField2, so the field can be used to retrieve the field index.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.ContainingObjectName
member.summary: Name of the containing object this field belongs to (entity or typed view). This name is required to retrieve persistence information in Adapter Set via constructor. This name is also used by EntityRelation to determine alias - table connection.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.DbValue
member.summary: Gets the value read from the database for this field. Use this field in optimistic concurrency predicates. Set by ForcedCurrentValueWrite(object, value) by the object fetcher logic.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.ObjectAlias
member.summary: Alias for the object containing the field this entity field is mapped on. Used in typed list selection lists.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.AggregateFunctionToApply
member.summary: The aggregate function to apply on this field in a select query. Ignored in INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE queries. Designed to be used in TypedList/TypedView classes.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.ExpressionToApply
member.summary: The expression to apply to this field in a select list, update statement or predicate. Expression is applied before AggregateFunctionToApply.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.IsForeignKey
member.summary: If set to true, in the constructor, this field is part of a foreign key. This field is not used in LLBLGen Pro's code, however can be useful in user code.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.IsNullable
member.summary: Will be true if this field can be set to NULL in the database, false otherwise. The Field Validation logic in an entity will use this flag to check if the field indeed can be set to NULL or not. Set by constructor.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.ActualContainingObjectName
member.summary: The name of the object this field is currently in. Differs only from ContainingObjectName if the field instance is in a subtype while it is originally defined in a supertype.
member.example: EmployeeEntity.Name and a subtype, ClerkEntity, inherits this field. For ClerkEntity.Name ContainingObjectName is still 'EmployeeEntity' however ActualContainingObjectName is 'ClerkEntity'.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityField2.IsInMultiTargetEntity
member.summary: Flag to signal if the field is in a multi-target entity. Used for alias production during query building in scenario's with inheritance.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityFields
member.summary: Class which forms the EntityFields2 type. An EntityFields type is a collection of IEntityField objects which forms the total amount of fields for a given entity. SelfServicing specific

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFields
member.summary: Interface for the EntityFields type. An EntityFields type is a collection of IEntityField objects which forms the total amount of fields for a given entity. SelfServicing specific

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFields.Expand(System.Int32)
member.summary: Expands this entity fields object by appending numberOfCells new cells to this object.
member.param: number of cells to append to this fieldsobject
member.remarks: Use with care. Empty cells can cause the DQE's to produce undefined results. Use this routine to append fields to a Typed list in code for example.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFields.Contract
member.summary: Contracts the list of fields so all empty slots at the end of the list of fields are removed. Doesn't perform a contract operation if the fields object is empty
member.returns: the new size of the fields object, or if the fields object is completely empty, the full size

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFields.Compact
member.summary: Compacts the list of fields so all empty slots are removed.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFields.GetHashCode
member.summary: Overrides the GetHashCode routine. It will calculate a hashcode for this set of entity fields using the eXclusive OR of the hashcodes of the primary key fields in this set of entity fields. That hashcode is returned. If no primary key fields are present, the hashcode of the base class is returned, which will not be unique.
member.returns: Hashcode for this entity object, based on its primary key field values

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFields.GetAsPersistenceInfoArray
member.summary: Returns the complete list of IEntityField objects as an array of IFieldPersistenceInfo objects. IEntityField objects implement IFieldPersistenceInfo.
member.returns: Array of IFieldPersistenceInfo objects

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFields.GetAsEntityFieldCoreArray
member.summary: Returns the complete list of IEntityField objects as an array of IEntityFieldCore objects. IEntityField objects implement IEntityFieldCore
member.returns: Array of IEntityFieldCore objects

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFields.WriteXml(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.XmlFormatAspect,System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Converts this EntityFields object to a set of XmlNodes with all the fields as individual nodes.
member.param: The aspect flags to control the format of the XML produced
the XmlDocument which will contain the nodes this method will create. This document is required to create the new nodes for the fields
the node the fields will have to be added to.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFields.ReadXml(System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Reads the fields which are childnodes of the passed in fieldsElement into this object

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFields.LinkFields(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Links the specified fields with eachother so setting one to a different value will automatically set the other one as well. This is required in target-per-entity entities which have multiple times the same PK field in their field list.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityFields.GetHashCode
member.summary: Overrides the GetHashCode routine. It will calculate a hashcode for this set of entity fields using the eXclusive OR of the hashcodes of the primary key fields in this set of entity fields. That hashcode is returned. If no primary key fields are present, the hashcode of the base class is returned, which will not be unique.
member.returns: Hashcode for this entity object, based on its primary key field values

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityFields.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares passed in object with the given object. This is a compare of PK fields. These have to be the same in VALUES. When the values are not the same, or the type is not the same as the current type, false is returned, true otherwise. When this doesn't have any PK fields, all fields are compared. null values are considered as the same value.
member.param: EntityFields object of the same type as this which will be compared to the PK values of this.
member.returns: True when the PK values of this are the same as the PK values of obj, or when this doesn't have any PK fields, all fields have the same value as obj's fields. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityFields2.GetHashCode
member.summary: Overrides the GetHashCode routine. It will calculate a hashcode for this set of entity fields using the eXclusive OR of the hashcodes of the primary key fields in this set of entity fields. That hashcode is returned. If no primary key fields are present, the hashcode of the base class is returned, which will not be unique.
member.returns: Hashcode for this entity object, based on its primary key field values

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityFields2.LinkFields(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Links the specified fields with eachother so setting one to a different value will automatically set the other one as well. This is required in target-per-entity entities which have multiple times the same PK field in their field list.
member.param: index of field in the supertype
index of field in the subtype

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityFields2.LinkFields
member.summary: Links the supertype PK fields with the subtype PK fields IF there are PK fields of multiple entities in the set of PK fields. Linking is required in target-per-entity entities which have multiple times the same PK field in their field list.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityFields2.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares passed in object with the given object. This is a compare of PK fields. These have to be the same in VALUES. When the values are not the same, or the type is not the same as the current type, false is returned, true otherwise. When this doesn't have any PK fields, all fields are compared. null values are considered as the same value.
member.param: EntityFields2 object which will be compared to the PK values of this.
member.returns: True when the PK values of this are the same as the PK values of obj, or when this doesn't have any PK fields, all fields have the same value as obj's fields. False otherwise.

member.summary: General class which defines the projection result and destination of a property of an entity.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityPropertyProjector
member.summary: Interface for defining the IEntityPropertyProjector type which is used for entity property projections when projecting an entityview's content onto another data store format.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityPropertyProjector.ProjectEntityProperty(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore)
member.summary: Projects the entity through this entity property projector and results into a single value, based on what the DefaultValueProducer is and what filter is specified (if any)
member.param: The entity to project. The DefaultValueProducer, ValueFilter, AlternativeValueProducer and the method to post process the value will determine what the returned value is
member.returns: Projection result of an entity's property using this entity property descriptor.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityPropertyProjector.DefaultValueProducer
member.summary: Gets or sets the default value producer. This object produces the value returned by ProjectEntityProperty if ValueFilter isn't set or resolves to true for the entity passed into ProjectEntityProperty.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityPropertyProjector.ValueFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets the value filter which can be used to select between the DefaultValueProducer and the AlternativeValueProducer. If this filter isn't set (null) or set to an IPredicate implementing object and at runtime the filter resolves to true for the entity passed into ProjectEntityProperty, the DefaultValueProducer is used, otherwise the AlternativeValueProducer. If AlternativeValueProducer isn't set, an ORMInterpretationException is thrown.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityPropertyProjector.AlternativeValueProducer
member.summary: Gets or sets the alternative value producer. Only used if ValueFilter is set to a valid filter and that filter resolves to false for the entity passed into ProjectEntityProperty.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityPropertyProjector.#ctor(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityFieldCore,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The default value provider object.This object produces the value returned by ProjectEntityProperty if ValueFilter isn't set or resolves to true for the entity passed into ProjectEntityProperty. Can't be null
Name for the projection result. Projection result consumers can use this name to further handle the projection result. Can't be null / empty string

member.param: the alias for the start entity in the relation. Alias is case sensitive. An alias with solely spaces or an empty string is ignored.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityRelation.ToggleArtificialAliasingForTargetPerEntityRelations(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables / disables the artificial aliasing for target per entity relations. This method is used to enable the artificial aliasing of entities which are in a hierarchy of TargetPerEntity and which are in this relation. This is switched on for dyn/typedlist fetches to be sure dyn/typedlists with fields from multiple entities in the same inheritance hierarchy will be retrievable properly, as they need aliasing under the hood but if the developer didn't alias the entities, the query will fail because the supertype(s) aren't joined multiple types.
member.param: if set to true, enable artificial aliasing, otherwise false (default).
member.remarks: Artificial aliasing is disabled by default

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityRelation.ResetArtificialAliases
member.summary: Resets the aliases for start/end entity if they're artificial.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityRelation.GetListOfEntityNamesOnHierarchyPath(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IInheritanceInfo)
member.summary: Gets the list of entity names on hierarchy path. This routine will first obtain the list of entity names from the passed in inheritance info object. If the hierarchy is of type TargetPerEntityHierarchy, it will suffix each name with ';1'. If the inheritance hierarchy is TargetPerEntityHierarchy, it will suffix each name with ';2'. This suffix is then used in DbSpecificCreatorBase to produce the proper aliases: a different one for each Alias - Entity combination if the hierarchy type is TargetPerEntityHierarchy, and the same for each Alias - Entity combination if they're in the same hierarchy.
member.param: The info.
member.returns: List of names, suffixed with the hierarchy type.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityRelation.DetermineIfIsWeak
member.summary: Determines if this relation is a weak relation (true) or not (false). 1:m is always weak by definition. 1:1 relations are weak when relation is seen from PK entity, otherwise always strong (when seen from FK entity). This can't be determined here, so 1:1 relations are always reported 'weak'.
member.returns: true when this relation is weak, false otherwise. Returns false by default.
member.remarks: Sees 1:1 not as a strong relation per se. Earlier versions did so.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityRelation.DetermineAlias(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines the alias for the side specified with the pkSide flag.
member.param: if true, the alias for teh PK side is determined, otherwise the FK side
member.returns: the alias for the side requested

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityRelation.CheckifAliasIsArtificial(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if the alias for the side specified is indeed an artificial alias. Artificial aliases are issued for sides which don't have an alias set and which are in a targetperentity hierarchy.
member.param: if set to true [pk side].
member.returns: true if the side has an artificial alias so Alias*Side and Alias*Entity return an artificial alias.
member.remarks: Returns always false if artificial aliasing is disabled (default).

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityRelation.BuildCustomFilter
member.summary: Builds the custom filter. If there's a custom filter specified and one or both sides are in a targetperentityhierarchy and have a typefilter in the inheritanceinfo, these filters are merged: customfilter AND (typefilterSTART AND typeFilterEND)
member.returns: Ready to use custom filter.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntitySyncInfo`1
member.summary: General synchronization information class for related entities to an existing entity. Used to keep track of which entity is set as a related entity using which relation and which field mapped on that relation so when the related entity is saved, it will be synced with the correct fields. The related entity is called a Data Suppling Entity.

member.summary: CTor

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntitySyncInfo`1.Used
member.summary: Gets / sets used flag. Flag to signal if the sync info has been used for syncing already. If not, it can be used to determine if the entity holding this sync info has to be saved or not.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntitySyncInfo`1.DataSupplyingEntity
member.summary: Gets / sets Data Supplying Entity value. Used for synchronization between related entities when they have to be synchronized.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntitySyncInfo`1.Relation
member.summary: Gets / sets the specific Entity Relation between two related entities (the entity holding this object and the entity specified in DataSupplyingEntity) for synchronization of values.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.EntityViewBase`1.SortIndices(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ISortExpression,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sorts the indices in the list passed in using the sortclause at the indexInSortExpression in sorter. If there are multiple entities which have the same value, this routine calls itself to sort those entities using the next sortclause until the sortexpression is done. It returns a new list with indices. All indices are indices in the related collection.
member.param: The list of indices to sort.
The sort expression to use.
The index in sort expression which points to the sortclause to use
member.returns: new list of indices with the entities at the indices in listToSort in the order implied by sorter[indexInSortExpression]
member.remarks: will use recursion if there are entities with the same value and there are more sort clauses / expressions specified.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.Expression
member.summary:
Expression class which defines field expressions which are applied to fields in a select list, in update queries or in field predicates.
Valid expressions:
Field
Field ExOp Field
Field ExOp Value
Field ExOp Expression
Value ExOp Field
Value ExOp Expression
Expression ExOp Field
Expression ExOp Value
Use one of the constructors to create the particular expression object.
member.remarks:
Values are transformed into parameters. The type of the parameter is determined of the field in the expression.
You can also use EntityProperty instances instead of EntityField(2) instances, though the Expression instance then has to be used solely for in-memory actions.

member.summary: CTor. Creates the Field Between Value1 And Value2 expression (Self servicing version)

Begin value in the Between clause. Can be a field object

Alias for the object the field belongs to. Used to identify which entity to use when the entity is present multiple times in a relation collection. Alias has to match an alias specified in the relation collection or should be left empty if no alias is specified (or no relation collection is used). In that case, use another overload.

End value in the Between clause. Can be a field object

Alias for the object the field belongs to. Used to identify which entity to use when the entity is present multiple times in a relation collection. Alias has to match an alias specified in the relation collection or should be left empty if no alias is specified (or no relation collection is used). In that case, use another overload.
Flag to make this expression add NOT to itself

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldBetweenPredicate.ToQueryText(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Implements the IPredicate ToQueryText method. Retrieves a ready to use text representation of the contained Predicate. The two parameters for begin and end value are constructed using the field's name plus the postfixes 'Begin' and 'End'. Generates SQL-92 syntaxis for BETWEEN, which is accepted by all databases known.
member.param: int counter which is appended to every parameter. The refcounter is increased by every parameter creation, making sure the parameter is unique in the predicate and also in the predicate expression(s) containing the predicate.
member.returns: The contained Predicate in textual format.
member.exception: When IPredicate.DatabaseSpecificCreator is not set to a valid value.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldBetweenPredicate.ToQueryText(System.Int32@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a ready to use text representation of the contained Predicate.
member.param: int counter which is appended to every parameter. The refcounter is increased by every parameter creation, making sure the parameter is unique in the predicate and also in the predicate expression(s) containing the predicate.
if set to true, it will allow aggregate functions to be applied to fields.
member.returns: The contained Predicate in textual format.
member.exception: When IPredicate.DatabaseSpecificCreator is not set to a valid value.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldCompareRangePredicate.ObjectAlias
member.summary: Alias for the object the field belongs to. Used to identify which entity to use when the entity is present multiple times in a relation collection. Alias has to match an alias specified in the relation collection or should be left empty if no alias is specified (or no relation collection is used).

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldCompareSetPredicate
member.summary: Implementation of a Field compare-operator Set expression, using the following format: IEntityField(Core) ComparisonOperator (Subquery)
member.remarks:
If the operator EXISTS is used, the field is ignored so can be set to null/Nothing, as the predicate will simply result in EXISTS (SELECT setField FROM ...)
This predicate isn't supported for in-memory filtering. Use FieldCompareRange for that.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldCompareValuePredicate.CaseSensitiveCollation
member.summary: Gets / sets caseSensitiveCollation flag. If set to true, the UPPER() function (or db specific equivalent) is applied to the field, IF the value specified is a string value. You can use this to do a case insensitive compare on a case sensitive database. Default: false

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldFullTextSearchPredicate
member.summary:
FieldFullTextSearchPredicate class. CONTAINS(IEntityField(Core), Parameter) (f.e. CONTAINS(Foo, @Foo) )
FREETEXT(IEntityField(Core), Parameter) (f.e. FREETEXT(Foo, @Foo) )
SqlServer specific.
On SqlServer 2005, also multi-field CONTAINS/FREETEXT predicates are supported.
member.remarks: This predicate isn't supported for in-memory filtering.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldInfo
member.summary: General container class for static field information which is readonly at runtime and which is equal for all instances of a given field. This information is shared among all instances of an entity, and therefore saves a lot of memory at runtime.

The scale.
The precision.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldInfo.Name
member.summary: The name of the field. Name cannot be of zero length nor can they consist of solely spaces. Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed.
member.exception: The value specified for Name is invalid.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldInfo.DataType
member.summary: The of the values of this field.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldInfo.IsPrimaryKey
member.summary: If set to true, in the constructor, this field will end up in the PrimaryKey field list of the containing IEntityFields object.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldInfo.IsNullable
member.summary: Will be true if this field can be set to NULL in the database, false otherwise. The Field Validation logic in an entity will use this flag to check if the field indeed can be set to NULL or not. Set by constructor.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldInfo.FieldIndex
member.summary: Gets the field index related to this IEntityField, so the field can be used to retrieve the field index.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldInfo.ContainingObjectName
member.summary: Name of the containing object this field belongs to (entity or typed view). This name is required to retrieve persistence information in Adapter Set via constructor. This name is also used by EntityRelation to determine alias - table connection.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldInfo.IsForeignKey
member.summary: If set to true, in the constructor, this field is part of a foreign key. This field is not used in LLBLGen Pro's code, however can be useful in user code.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldInfo.IsReadOnly
member.summary: If set to true, in the constructor, no changes can be made to this field.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldInfo.MaxLength
member.summary: The maximum length of the value of the entityfield (string/binary data). Is ignored for entityfields which hold non-string and non-binary values. Value initially set for this field is the length of the database column this field is mapped on.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldInfo.Scale
member.summary: The scale of the value for this field. Value initially set for this field is the scale of the database column this field is mapped on.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldInfo.Precision
member.summary: The precision of the value for this field. Value initially set for this field is the precision of the database column this field is mapped on.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldInfo.ActualContainingObjectName
member.summary: The name of the object this field is currently in. Differs only from ContainingObjectName if the field instance is in a subtype while it is originally defined in a supertype.
member.example: EmployeeEntity.Name and a subtype, ClerkEntity, inherits this field. For ClerkEntity.Name ContainingObjectName is still 'EmployeeEntity' however ActualContainingObjectName is 'ClerkEntity'.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldInfo.IsInMultiTargetEntity
member.summary: Flag to signal if the field is in a multi-target entity. Used for alias production during query building in scenario's with inheritance.

member.summary: CTor for Field LIKE Pattern.
member.param: Field to compare with the LIKE operator

Alias for the object the field belongs to. Used to identify which entity to use when the entity is present multiple times in a relation collection. Pattern to use in the LIKE expression

member.summary: Implements the IPredicate ToQueryText method. Retrieves a ready to use text representation of the contained Predicate.
member.param: int counter which is appended to every parameter. The refcounter is increased by every parameter creation, making sure the parameter is unique in the predicate and also in the predicate expression(s) containing the predicate.
member.returns: The contained Predicate in textual format.
member.exception: When IPredicate.DatabaseSpecificCreator is not set to a valid value.

if set to true, it will allow aggregate functions to be applied to fields.
member.returns: The contained Predicate in textual format.
member.exception: When IPredicate.DatabaseSpecificCreator is not set to a valid value.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldLikePredicate.Pattern
member.summary: Gets / sets the pattern to use in a Field LIKE Pattern clause.
member.remarks: if this predicate is used in in-memory filtering, this pattern can also be a regular expression, though in that case, don't use % characters but normal regular expression characters. If this pattern is a regular expression, set the flag PatternIsRegEx to true. If PatternRegEx is false, the value of Pattern is considered a normal string with the standard LIKE syntaxis (i.e. with % as wildcard).

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldLikePredicate.PatternIsRegEx
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the string specified in Pattern is a regular expression (true) or not (false). Only used for in-memory filtering, ignored when predicate is used in database filters.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldLikePredicate.ObjectAlias

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldLikePredicate.CaseSensitiveCollation
member.summary: Gets / sets caseSensitiveCollation flag. If set to true, the UPPER() function (or db specific equivalent) is applied to the field. Default: false

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldPersistenceInfo
member.summary: Generic class which holds the generic information for entity field persistence of an entity field. Instances of this interface are passed to logic with an instance of the IEntityFieldCore interface. SelfServicing implements both interfaces in one interface: IEntityField. Generic

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldPersistenceInfo.#ctor
member.summary: CTor. Necessary for serialization. Do not use this CTor in code.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.FieldPersistenceInfo.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Boolean,System.String,System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter,System.Type)
member.summary: CTor
member.param: The name of the schema which holds SourceObjectName. Schema is used to generate SQL on the fly. A common schema name in SqlServer is f.e. 'dbo'.
The name of the source object which holds SourceColumnName. Can be a view or a table. Used to generate SQL on the fly.
The name of the corresponding column in a view or table for the corresponding entity/view field. This name is used to map a column in a resultset onto the entity field.
Flag if the Column mapped is nullable or not.
The type of the Column. The value stored here is the integer representation of the enum value of the type, f.e. SqlDbType.Int or OracleType.Int16
The maximum length of the value for this column (string/binary data). Is ignored for columns which hold non-string and non-binary values.
The scale of the Column mapped onto the entityfield.
The precision of the Column mapped onto the entityfield.

If set to true, the Dynamic Query Engine (DQE) will assume the field is an Identity field and will act accordingly (i.e.: as the target database handles Identity fields: SqlServer will generate a new value itself, Oracle wants to have a sequence input.

If isIdentity is set to true, this property has to be set to the name of the sequence which supplies the value for the column. On SqlServer this is @@IDENTITY or SCOPE_IDENTITY() and only used when the row is succesfully inserted, however on Oracle f.e. this value is used to specify a new value and to retrieve the new value. Is undefined when isIdentity is set to false.
Type converter set when a conversion is required from the .NET type returned by the ADO.NET provider and the defined .NET type for this field.
The .NET type of the field in the DB. This value is used to convert a currentvalue back to this type using TypeConverterToUse.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IInheritanceInfoProvider
member.summary: Interface for inheritanceinfo provider objects and other inheritance information. InheritanceInfo objects provide inheritance information at runtime for the DQE's and helper classes. The information inside these providers has to be statically constructed and should not change at runtime to make it threadsafe. These providers supply the DQE with detailed inheritance information so queries can be formed for any entity hierarchy.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IInheritanceInfoProvider.GetInheritanceInfo(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets an IInheritanceInfo object with the inheritance information for the entity with the supplied name.
member.param: name of the entity, like "CustomerEntity". This name is used for retrieving the information from a thread safe hashtable
Set to if the relations in have to start with the root and walk downwards to the entityName entity, or set to false if the relations have to start at the entityname and move upwards to the root.
member.returns: Ready to use IInheritanceInfo object if entityName is part of a hierarchy. If entityName isn't part of a hierarchy, null is returned. (not part of a hierarchy means: not a supertype nor a subtype

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IInheritanceInfoProvider.GetHierarchyRelations(System.String)
member.summary: This method returns all relations from the entityName to the root and from the entityName downwards to all the reachable leafs from entityName. All relations to the root are INNER JOIN, all relations from entityName to leafs are LEFT JOIN
member.param: name of the current entity on the path of which the hierarchy has to be determined. Example: "CustomerEntity"
member.returns: collection with relations if entityName was found, or null if not.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IInheritanceInfoProvider.GetHierarchyRelations(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: This method returns all relations from the lowest entity found in the passed in entityNames to the root and from the lowest entityName downwards to all the reachable leafs from entityName. All relations to the root are INNER JOIN, all relations from the lowest entityName to leafs are LEFT JOIN
member.param: 1 or more names of entities on the same path of which the hierarchy has to be determined. Example of a name: "CustomerEntity"
member.returns: collection with relations if all entityNames were found, or null if not.
member.remarks: This method is a wrapper around GetHierarchyRelations(name), to make finding the right collection more efficient. It finds the lowest entityname in the hierarchy and calls GetHierarchyRelations(name) with that name.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IInheritanceInfoProvider.GetHierarchyFields(System.String)
member.summary: This method returns an array of IEntityFieldCore objects which contains all fields of all entities on the path: entityName upwards to the root and entityName downwards to all leafs reachable from entityName, including entityName.
member.param: name of the current entity on the path of which the hierarchy fields has to be determined. Example: "CustomerEntity"
member.returns: Array of IEntityFieldCore objects, each element represents one field, or null if entityName isn't found

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IInheritanceInfoProvider.GetEntityFactory(System.String,System.Object[],System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Int32})
member.summary: Retrieves the factory for the entity represented by the values passed in, or null if entityName isn't present. The values have to represent an entity of the type entityName or a subtype of that type.
member.param: name of the entity, like 'CustomerEntity'. This is the name of the root of the hierarchy to consider. For example when fetching all managers, and manager derives from employee, this parameter is 'ManagerEntity', and only the manager type or its subtypes (direct or indirect) are considered.
Field values read from the db, to determine which factory to return, based on the field values passed in.
indexes into values where per entity type their own fields start.
member.returns: the factory for the entity which is represented by the values passed in.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.InheritanceInfoProviderBase.GetHierarchyRelations(System.String)
member.summary: This method returns all relations from the entityName to the root and from the entityName downwards to all the reachable leafs from entityName. All relations to the root are INNER JOIN, all relations from entityName to leafs are LEFT JOIN
member.param: name of the current entity on the path of which the hierarchy has to be determined. Example: "CustomerEntity"

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.InheritanceInfoProviderBase.GetHierarchyRelations(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: This method returns all relations from the lowest entity found in the passed in entityNames to the root and from the lowest entityName downwards to all the reachable leafs from entityName. All relations to the root are INNER JOIN, all relations from the lowest entityName to leafs are LEFT JOIN.
member.param: 1 or more names of entities on the same path of which the hierarchy has to be determined. Example of a name: "CustomerEntity"
member.returns: collection with relations if all entityNames were found, or null if not.
member.remarks: This method is a wrapper around GetHierarchyRelations(name), to make finding the right collection more efficient. It finds the lowest entityname in the hierarchy and calls GetHierarchyRelations(name) with that name. It assumes the names are on the same path to the root.
member.exception: when not all entities specified in entityNames are on the same hierarchical path

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.InheritanceInfoProviderBase.GetHierarchyFields(System.String)
member.summary: This method returns an array of IEntityFieldCore objects which contains all fields of all entities on the path: entityName upwards to the root and entityName downwards to all leafs reachable from entityName, including entityName.

member.returns: Array of IEntityFieldCore objects, each element represents one field, or null if entityName isn't found. When fields are returned, their aliases are set from front to back as 'Fx' where x is the index in the array, starting with 0.
member.remarks: This routine uses no subroutines to avoid thread unsafety.

member.summary: The EntityType enum value for the entity to fetch defined by this path element.
member.remarks: Set in the constructor

member.summary: The maximum amount of entities to set per destination instance.

member.summary: The sort expression to sort the entities per destination instance.

member.summary: The filter predicate expression to fetch the ToFetch entities. Initially this is set in the constructor. Add additional predicates to this predicate expression.

member.summary: The relations to use in the filters. Initially this is an empty collection, as the fetches use subqueries. Add additional relations to this relation collection to have multi-entity filters.

member.summary: Gets or sets the graph level.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPrefetchPathElementCore.ExcludedIncludedFields
member.summary: Gets / sets the list of IEntityFieldCore objects which have to be excluded or included for the fetch. If null or empty, all fields are fetched (default). If an instance of ExcludeIncludeFieldsList is passed in and its ExcludeContainedFields property is set to false, the fields contained in excludedIncludedFields are kept in the query, the rest of the fields in the query are excluded.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPrefetchPathElement.SubPath
member.summary: The subpath containing path elements to retrieve in the ToFetch entity of this PrefetchPathElement. Can be empty.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPrefetchPathElement.RetrievalCollection
member.summary: The entity collection to fill (and to use to retrieve the entities to fetch). After the fetch, this collection contains the entities to merge with the instances of the parent entity.

member.param: The PrefetchPathElement to add

The list of IEntityField objects which have to be excluded or included for the fetch. If null or empty, all fields are fetched (default). If an instance of ExcludeIncludeFieldsList is passed in and its ExcludeContainedFields property is set to false, the fields contained in excludedIncludedFields are kept in the query, the rest of the fields in the query are excluded.
member.returns: the element added, so chaining of commands is possible

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ITransaction
member.summary: Interface for the definition of a Transaction class which is used to control a serie of actions on multiple entities or entity collection classes. SelfServicing specific

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ITransaction.Commit
member.summary: Commits the transaction in action. It will end all database activity, since commiting a transaction is finalizing it. After calling Commit or Rollback, the ITransaction implementing class will reset itself. When used in combination of COM+, it will call ContextUtil.SetComplete() to commit the current COM+ transaction.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ITransaction.Rollback
member.summary: Rolls back the transaction in action. It will end all database activity, since commiting a transaction is finalizing it. After calling Commit or Rollback, the ITransaction implementing class will reset itself. When used in combination of COM+, it will call ContextUtil.SetAbort() to abort (rollback) the current COM+ transaction.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ITransaction.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a savepoint with the name savePointName in the current transaction. You can roll back to this savepoint using .
member.param: name of savepoint. Must be unique in an active transaction
member.exception: If no transaction is in progress.
if savePointName is empty or null
if the .NET database provider doesn't support transaction saving or when COM+ is used.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ITransaction.Rollback(System.String)
member.summary: Rolls back the transaction in action to the savepoint with the name savepointName. No internal objects are being reset when this method is called, so call this Rollback overload only to roll back to a savepoint. To roll back a complete transaction, call Rollback() without specifying a savepoint name. Create a savepoint by calling Save(savePointName)
member.param: name of the savepoint to roll back to.
member.exception: If no transaction is in progress.
if savePointName is empty or null
if the .NET database provider doesn't support transaction rolling back a transaction to a named point or when COM+ is used.
member.remarks: Not supported when using COM+

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ITypedListCore.ObeyWeakRelations
member.summary: Gets / sets ObeyWeakRelations, which is the flag to signal the collection what kind of join statements to generate in the query statement. Weak relationships are relationships which are optional, for example a customer with no orders is possible, because the relationship between customer and order is based on a field in order. When this property is set to true (default: false), weak relationships will result in LEFT JOIN statements. When set to false (which is the default), INNER JOIN statements are used.

member.summary: Interface for retrieval queries. These queries do return a resultset. Retrieval queries execute Select statements. Generic

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRetrievalQuery.Execute(System.Data.CommandBehavior)
member.summary: Executes the query contained by the IQuery instance. The connection has to be opened before calling Execute().
member.param: The behavior setting to pass to the ExecuteReader method.
member.returns: An open, ready to use IDataReader instance
member.exception: When there is no command object inside the query object, or no connection object inside the query object or the connection is closed.

member.summary: Executes the query contained by the IQuery instance as a scalar query.
member.returns: the value returned by the scalar execution of the query

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRetrievalQuery.RequiresClientSideLimitation
member.summary: Gets / sets the flag which signals fetch code to use client side (i.e. in code) limitation logic and it should not rely on the amount of rows returned for row limitations. This flag is set by DQEs if DISTINCT can't be used but row limitations are required and TOP is thus not reliable. Default: false.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRetrievalQuery.MaxNumberOfItemsToReturnClientSide
member.summary: Used to set the amount of items to return for client side limitations. Only used if is true.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRetrievalQuery.RequiresClientSideDistinctFiltering
member.summary: Flag to tell the object fetcher to use manual distinct filtering, as the DISTINCT command couldn't be applied. Used to tell paging wrappers to set RequiresClientSidePaging.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRetrievalQuery.RequiresClientSidePaging
member.summary: Flag to tell the object fetcher to use manual paging. This is required when DISTINCT is required however due to DISTINCT violating types it can't be applied to the query. This then causes duplicates in the resultset, which shouldn't be there and thus causing pages with much lesser data. Only set by a DQE, normally false.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRetrievalQuery.ManualPageNumber
member.summary: Only valid when RequiresClientSidePaging is set to true. Required to calculate the actual page start.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRetrievalQuery.ManualPageSize
member.summary: Only valid when RequiresClientSidePaging is set to true. Required to calculate the actual page start.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ISequenceRetrievalQuery
member.summary: Interface for sequence retrieval queries. Sequence retrieval queries are scalar queries (returning a value) which are used to retrieve the actual / to use sequence value in systems which do not support batched queries. Normally every DQE will batch the sequence retrieval query into the INSERT query as a batched query, however some systems do not support this and the only solution is the SequenceRetrievalQuery. Used for Access, Firebird and other systems. SequenceRetrievalQueries can be added to IActionQuery instances and will use the IActionQuery object's connection object.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ISequenceRetrievalQuery.Execute
member.summary: Executes the scalar query contained in this object. (Executed with ExecuteScalar()) Expects that the command can be executed without problems.
member.remarks: Will store its value in the sequence parameters after execution
member.exception: When there is no command object set
when an exception was caught during query execution

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ISequenceRetrievalQuery.SequenceRetrievalCommand
member.summary: The Scalar command used to retrieve the used/to use sequence value. This command will be executed as a scalar query and depending on ExecuteSequenceCommandFirst it will be executed before or after the actual query.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ISequenceRetrievalQuery.ExecuteSequenceCommandFirst
member.summary: Flag to signal if SequenceRetrievalCommand has to be executed before (true) or after (false) the actual query in this ActionQuery object.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ISequenceRetrievalQuery.SequenceParameters
member.summary: Array list with the parameter objects in the actual query which need the value returned by the execution of the command

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ISequenceRetrievalQuery.SetParametersAsOutputParameters
member.summary: Used to make SequenceParameters 'output' parameters. Required for Access. Default: false;

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ISortClause
member.summary: Interface definition for a class which forms a single sort clause, thus an order by definition defined for a single IEntityField or IEntityField - IFieldPersistenceInfo combination PersistenceInfo will return the same object when an IEntityField is added to the object. Generic

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ISortClause.FieldToSortCore
member.summary: IEntityFieldCore to sort on.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ISortClause.PersistenceInfo
member.summary: Persistence information for FieldToSort. Can be a cast of the same object, when an IEntityField is added to this sort clause

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ISortClause.SortOperatorToUse
member.summary: The sort operator to use for this sort clause

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ISortClause.ObjectAlias
member.summary: Alias for the object the field belongs to. Used to identify which entity to use when the entity is present multiple times in a relation collection. Alias has to match an alias specified in the relation collection or should be left empty if no alias is specified (or no relation collection is used).

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ISortClause.CaseSensitiveCollation
member.summary: Gets / sets the CaseSensitiveCollation flag. If set to true, the UPPER() function (or db specific equivalent) is applied to the field in the ORDER BY clause. Default: false
member.remarks: CaseSensitiveCollation is also used for in-memory sorts. If set to true, sorts in-memory will be case insensitive, otherwise sorts will be case sensitive. The default for in-memory sorts is the same as for sorts on the db: false.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ISortExpression.ToQueryText(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves a ready to use text representation for the sort clauses contained in this expression.
member.param: int counter which is appended to every parameter. The refcounter is increased by every parameter creation, making sure the parameter is unique in the query
member.returns: string which is usable as the argument for the ORDER BY clause in a query
member.remarks: uses aliases for fields which have an expression and/or aggregate applied.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ISortExpression.ToQueryText(System.Int32@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a ready to use text representation for the sort clauses contained in this expression.
member.param: int counter which is appended to every parameter. The refcounter is increased by every parameter creation, making sure the parameter is unique in the query

If set to false (default is true), the full field name with expression / aggregate is placed in the result string instead of the alias of the field. If set to true, aliases are used for fields with an expression and/or aggregate applied.
member.returns: string which is usable as the argument for the ORDER BY clause in a query

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IValidator
member.summary: Interface for validation classes used by implementing classes. Generic

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IValidator.ValidateFieldValue(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Validates the given EntityFieldCore object on the given fieldIndex with the given value. This routine is called by the Entity's own value validator after the value has passed validation for destination column type and null values.
member.param: The involved entity.
Index of IEntityFieldCore to validate
Value which should be stored in field with index fieldIndex. Will not be null (earlier logic filters out nulls before a call will be made to this routine).
member.returns: true if the value is valid for the field, false otherwise
member.remarks: Use the entity.SetEntityFieldError() and entity.SetEntityError() methods if you want to set a IDataErrorInfo error string after the validation.

member.summary: Method to validate the containing entity right before the save sequence for the entity will start. LLBLGen Pro will call this method right after the containing entity is selected from the save queue to be saved.
member.param: The involved entity.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IValidator.ValidateEntityAfterSave(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore)
member.summary: Method to validate the containing entity right after the entity's save action has been completed and the entity has been refetched (if applicable). Note for adapter users: if the entity wasn't set to be refetched, take into account that reading properties from the containing entity will result in an OutOfSync exception.
member.param: The involved entity.

member.param: The involved entity.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IValidator.ValidateEntity(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityCore)

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRelationCollection.ToQueryText(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Converts the set of relations to a set of nested JOIN query elements using ANSI join syntaxis. Oracle 8i doesn't support ANSI join syntaxis and therefore the OracleDQE has its own join code. It uses a database specific creator object for database specific syntaxis, like the format of the tables / views and fields.
member.param: int counter which is appended to every parameter. The refcounter is increased by every parameter creation, making sure the parameter is unique in the custom filter predicates
member.returns: The string representation of the INNER JOIN expressions of the contained relations, when ObeyWeakRelations is set to false (default) or the string representation of the LEFT/RIGHT JOIN expressions of the contained relations, when ObeyWeakRelations is set to true
member.exception: When the DatabaseSpecificCreator is not set.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRelationCollection.GetUsedEntityTypeNamesAndAliases(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.MultiValueHashtable{System.String,System.String},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Gets per alias specified in a relation all entity names covered by that alias. This means that if an entity in a relation is based on multiple entities (through inheritance) it will return all entity names the entity is based on, from the actual entity to the root of the hierarchy path and every entity name in between.
member.param: Entity names per alias multivaluehashtable: per alias (key) all entity names are stored in a uniquevaluelist.

The artificial alias per entity. This collection contains per entity (key) the artificial alias (value), IF such an artificial alias has been given out. (only done with entities which are part of a hierarchy of type TargetPerEntity)

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRelationCollection.DatabaseSpecificCreator
member.summary: Object which will be used to create valid parameter objects, field names, including prefix/postfix characters, and conversion routines, and field names, including prefix/postfix characters. Uses the strategy pattern so the generic code can work with more than one target database.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRelationCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Indexer in the collection.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRelationCollection.ObeyWeakRelations
member.summary: Gets / sets ObeyWeakRelations, which is the flag to signal the collection what kind of join statements to generate in the ToQueryText statement, which is called by the DQE. Weak relationships are relationships which are optional, for example a customer with no orders is possible, because the relationship between customer and order is based on a field in order. When this property is set to true (default: false), weak relationships will result in LEFT JOIN statements. When set to false (which is the default), INNER JOIN statements are used.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IRelationCollection.Count
member.summary: Returns the amount of relations in this object

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.MemberPredicate
member.summary: Predicate class which allows in-memory filters to perform a predicate on one or more related entities. The entity this predicate is applied on has to have a member property with the name specified. Each element in that member (or the member itself, in case of a single instance) will be interpreted with the specified filter. The result of that interpretation is used together with the MemberOperator specified what the result of this predicate will be: true or false, in which case the entity this predicate is applied on is accepted (true) or not (false).
member.remarks: Meant for in-memory filtering. Can't be used in database targeting filters.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.MemberPredicate.#ctor(System.String,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.MemberOperator,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPredicate)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Name of the member of the entity this predicate is applied on, on which filter has to be applied.
The operator to use.
The filter to apply to elements of the member (or the member itself in case of a single instance).

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.MemberPredicate.#ctor(System.String,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.MemberOperator,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IPredicate,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Name of the member of the entity this predicate is applied on, on which filter has to be applied.
The operator to use.
The filter to apply to elements of the member (or the member itself in case of a single instance).
If true, the result of the MemberPredicate will be negated prior to return.

member.remarks: By default this method throws a NotSupported exception. It is only implemented on predicates which can be used for in-memory filtering.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.PrefetchPath
member.summary: PrefetchPath class, which specifies a prefetch path to fetch related entities during a fetch. SelfServicing specific.

member.name: F:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.PrefetchPath.UseRootMaxLimitAndSorterInPrefetchPathSubQueries
member.summary: Flag to switch off the usage of the max limit and sorter used to fetch the root of the path in subqueries. The root limit and sorter is added to the subquery filtering on the root entities in v2.5 by default as an optimization. Some queries/databases can suffer from this, so this should be optional. To switch it off, add a line to the config file appSettings section: useRootMaxLimitAndSorterInPrefetchPathSubQueries. Default is false.
member.remarks: This optimization is switched off in v2.5. A fix is necessary in v2.6 for some situations. Enabling this could make some queries fail at runtime on sqlserver.

The list of IEntityField objects which have to be excluded or included for the fetch. If null or empty, all fields are fetched (default). member.summary: Adds the passed in IEntityRelation instance to the list, under the alias specified for the end entity. The start entity gets no alias. The weakness of the relation is considered based on the ObeyWeakRelations setting.
member.param: IEntityRelation instance to add

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.RelationCollection.Add(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityRelation,System.String,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.JoinHint)

member.param: IEntityRelation instance to add
the alias for the end entity in the relation (Customer.Relations.OrderUsingCustomerID: Order is end entity). Alias is case sensitive
Hint to signal the join type for this relation. Overrules obeyWeakRelations, except when the hint is JoinHint.None.
member.returns: the added relation in the list, so you can chain commands on 1 line
member.exception: when aliasRelationEndEntity is an empty string, null or otherwise unusable alias (contains spaces)

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.RelationCollection.Add(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.IEntityRelation,System.String,System.String,SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.JoinHint)
member.summary: Adds the passed in IEntityRelation instance to the list, under the aliases specified and will consider the relation's weakness based on the hint value. The start entity gets no alias.
member.param: IEntityRelation instance to add
the alias for the start entity in the relation (Customer.Relations.OrderUsingCustomerID: Customer is start entity). Alias is case sensitive
the alias for the end entity in the relation (Customer.Relations.OrderUsingCustomerID: Order is end entity). Alias is case sensitive
Hint to signal the join type for this relation. Overrules obeyWeakRelations, except when the hint is JoinHint.None.
member.returns: the added relation in the list, so you can chain commands on 1 line
member.exception: when aliasRelationEndEntity or aliasRelationStartEntity are an empty string, null or otherwise unusable alias (contains spaces)

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.RelationCollection.GetUsedEntityTypeNamesAndAliases(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.MultiValueHashtable{System.String,System.String},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Gets per alias specified in a relation all entity names covered by that alias. This means that if an entity in a relation is based on multiple entities (through inheritance) it will return all entity names the entity is based on, from the actual entity to the root of the hierarchy path and every entity name in between.
member.param: Entity names per alias multivaluehashtable: per alias (key) all entity names are stored in a uniquevaluelist.

The artificial alias per entity. This collection contains per entity (key) the artificial alias (value), IF such an artificial alias has been given out. (only done with entities which are part of a hierarchy of type TargetPerEntity)

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.RelationCollection.ToQueryText(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Converts the set of relations to a set of nested JOIN query elements using ANSI join syntaxis. Oracle 8i doesn't support ANSI join syntaxis and therefore the OracleDQE has its own join code. It uses a database specific creator object for database specific syntaxis, like the format of the tables / views and fields.
member.param: int counter which is appended to every parameter. The refcounter is increased by every parameter creation, making sure the parameter is unique in the custom filter predicates
member.returns: The string representation of the INNER JOIN expressions of the contained relations, when ObeyWeakRelations is set to false (default) or the string representation of the LEFT/RIGHT JOIN expressions of the contained relations, when ObeyWeakRelations is set to true
member.exception: When the DatabaseSpecificCreator is not set

when the relation set contains an error and is badly formed. For example when the relation collection contains relations which do not have an entity in common, which can happen when a bad alias is specified

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.RelationCollection.PreprocessRelations
member.summary: Preprocesses the relations in this relationcollection The start/end entity can have an inheritance info object with them, causing these relations to be inserted at that spot, where the additional relations for the start entity are added BEFORE the actual relation and the relations for the end entity AFTER the actual relation.
member.returns: the full set of relations to process

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.RelationCollection.ToggleArtificialAliasingForTargetPerEntityRelations(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables / disables the artificial aliasing for target per entity relations. This method is used to enable the artificial aliasing of entities which are in a hierarchy of TargetPerEntity and which are in the relations of this collection. This is switched on for dyn/typedlist fetches to be sure dyn/typedlists with fields from multiple entities in the same inheritance hierarchy will be retrievable properly, as they need aliasing under the hood but if the developer didn't alias the entities, the query will fail because the supertype(s) aren't joined multiple types.
member.param: if set to true, enable artificial aliasing, otherwise false (default).
member.remarks: Artificial aliasing is disabled by default

member.summary: Adds the sub relation to the relations to return collection.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.RelationCollection.ObeyWeakRelations
member.summary: Gets / sets ObeyWeakRelations, which is the flag to signal the collection what kind of join statements to generate in the ToQueryText statement, which is called by the DQE. Weak relationships are relationships which are optional, for example a customer with no orders is possible, because the relationship between customer and order is based on a field in order. When this property is set to true (default: false), weak relationships will result in LEFT JOIN statements. When set to false (which is the default), INNER JOIN statements are used.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.RetrievalQuery.RequiresClientSideLimitation
member.summary: Gets / sets the flag which signals fetch code to use client side (i.e. in code) limitation logic and it should not rely on the amount of rows returned for row limitations. This flag is set by DQEs if DISTINCT can't be used but row limitations are required and TOP is thus not reliable. Default: false.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.RetrievalQuery.MaxNumberOfItemsToReturnClientSide
member.summary: Used to set the amount of items to return for client side limitations. Only used if is true.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.RetrievalQuery.RequiresClientSidePaging
member.summary: Flag to tell the object fetcher to use manual paging. This is required when DISTINCT is required however due to DISTINCT violating types it can't be applied to the query. This then causes duplicates in the resultset, which shouldn't be there and thus causing pages with much lesser data. Only set by a DQE, normally false.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.RetrievalQuery.ManualPageNumber
member.summary: Only valid when RequiresClientSidePaging is set to true. Required to calculate the actual page start.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.RetrievalQuery.ManualPageSize
member.summary: Only valid when RequiresClientSidePaging is set to true. Required to calculate the actual page start.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.RetrievalQuery.RequiresClientSideDistinctFiltering
member.summary: Flag to tell the object fetcher to use manual distinct filtering, as the DISTINCT command couldn't be applied. Used to tell paging wrappers to set RequiresClientSidePaging.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ScalarQueryExpression
member.summary: Class which implements a scalar query which is usable inside an expression. This expression assumes the query formulated will result in a single value. If that's not the case, use the overload of the CTor which accepts a value for forceRowLimit or set its ForceRowLimit property to true (default: false). If forceRowLimit is set to true, a TOP 1 clause will be emitted into the query to force the query to result into a single value. Normally you don't need to do this as a scalar query has to be formulated as a single value anyway.

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.SequenceRetrievalQuery
member.summary: Class for sequence retrieval queries. Sequence retrieval queries are scalar queries (returning a value) which are used to retrieve the actual / to use sequence value in systems which do not support batched queries. Normally every DQE will batch the sequence retrieval query into the INSERT query as a batched query, however some systems do not support this and the only solution is the SequenceRetrievalQuery. Used for Access, Firebird and other systems. SequenceRetrievalQueries can be added to IActionQuery instances and will use the IActionQuery object's connection object.

member.remarks: Will store its value in the sequence parameters after execution
member.exception: When there is no command object set
when an exception was caught during query execution

member.name: T:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.TransactionBase
member.summary: Abstract transaction class which is used to control a serie of actions on multiple entities or entity collection classes. The database connection is opened in the constructor, so the transaction instance is ready to use. This class is the non-COM+ version, it will always start a new ADO.NET transaction and will not be using a COM+ transaction when callers are participating in such a transaction.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.TransactionBase.#ctor(System.Data.IsolationLevel,System.String)
member.summary: CTor. Will read the connection string from an external source.
member.param: IsolationLevel to use in the transaction
The name of the transaction to use.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.TransactionBase.#ctor(System.Data.IsolationLevel,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: CTor.
member.param: IsolationLevel to use in the transaction
The name of the transaction to use.
Connection string to use in this transaction

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.TransactionBase.Commit
member.summary: Commits the transaction in action. It will end all database activity, since commiting a transaction is finalizing it. After calling Commit or Rollback, the ITransaction implementing class will reset itself. When used in combination of COM+, it will call ContextUtil.SetCommit() to commit the current COM+ transaction.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.TransactionBase.Add(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ITransactionalElement)
member.summary: Adds the passed in object as a participant of this transaction.
member.param: The ITransactionalElement implementing object which actions have to be included in this transaction

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.TransactionBase.Remove(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ITransactionalElement)
member.summary: Removes the passed in object from the transaction.
member.param: The ITransactionalElement implementing object which should be removed from this transaction

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.TransactionBase.Rollback
member.summary: Rolls back the transaction in action. It will end all database activity, since commiting a transaction is finalizing it. After calling Commit or Rollback, the ITransaction implementing class will reset itself. When used in combination of COM+, it will call ContextUtil.SetAbort() to abort (rollback) the current COM+ transaction.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.TransactionBase.Dispose
member.summary: Implements the IDispose' method Dispose.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.TransactionBase.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a savepoint with the name savePointName in the current transaction. You can roll back to this savepoint using .
member.param: name of savepoint. Must be unique in an active transaction
member.exception: If no transaction is in progress.
if savePointName is empty or null or there is already a savepoint defined with the name specified
if the .NET database provider doesn't support transaction saving or when COM+ is used.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.TransactionBase.Rollback(System.String)
member.summary: Rolls back the transaction in action to the savepoint with the name savepointName. No internal objects are being reset when this method is called, so call this Rollback overload only to roll back to a savepoint. To roll back a complete transaction, call Rollback() without specifying a savepoint name. Create a savepoint by calling Save(savePointName)
member.param: name of the savepoint to roll back to.
member.exception: If no transaction is in progress.
if savePointName is empty or null or there is no savepoint defined with the name specified
if the .NET database provider doesn't support transaction rolling back a transaction to a named point or when COM+ is used.
member.remarks: Not supported when using COM+

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.TypedListCore.ObeyWeakRelations
member.summary: Gets / sets ObeyWeakRelations, which is the flag to signal the collection what kind of join statements to generate in the query statement. Weak relationships are relationships which are optional, for example a customer with no orders is possible, because the relationship between customer and order is based on a field in order. When this property is set to true (default: false), weak relationships will result in LEFT JOIN statements. When set to false (which is the default), INNER JOIN statements are used.

member.summary: Gets the insert queue, which is a list of ActionQueueElements(of IEntity) which have been placed in the insert queue. This queue is empty unless has been called, or Commit has been called, which calls under the hood. If this method is called after Commit, and Commit succeeded, the entities in the queue returned are saved succesfully. Calling will not clear the queues, only or Commit will.
member.returns: List of ActionQueueElement(of IEntity) elements with the entities in the insert queue.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.UnitOfWork.GetUpdateQueue
member.summary: Gets the update queue, which is a list of ActionQueueElements(of IEntity) which have been placed in the update queue. This queue is empty unless has been called, or Commit has been called, which calls under the hood. If this method is called after Commit, and Commit succeeded, the entities in the queue returned are saved succesfully. Calling will not clear the queues, only or Commit will.
member.returns: List of ActionQueueElement(of IEntity) elements with the entities in the insert queue.

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.UnitOfWork.Commit(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ITransaction)
member.summary: Commits this unit of work. It will first add all entities in the added collections to the correct bins, then it will start by first inserting all new entities, then saving all updates and then performing the deletes.
member.param: Transaction to use. All entities to process will be added to this transaction, unless they're already part of another transaction.
member.remarks: It will not commit nor rollback the transaction.
member.exception: when transactionToUse is null
member.returns: The total # of entities affected by all actions performed in the Commit method

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.UnitOfWork.Commit(SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.ITransaction,System.Boolean)

member.name: M:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.UnitOfWork.ConstructSaveProcessQueues
member.summary: Constructs the save process queues for insert and update actions. These queues are constructed from the entities added to this UoW for save either individually or in a collection. Call this method to determine what the sequence will be for the insert and update actions executed during Commit(). Commit() uses this method as well as well as the serialization/deserialization logic, to avoid sending large object graphs with few changes.

member.name: P:SD.LLBLGen.Pro.ORMSupportClasses.UnitOfWork.OptimizedSerialization
member.summary: Gets / sets the OptimizedSerialization flag. Default: true. When set to false, the serialization logic will simply serialize all entities inside the unit of work. When set to true, the unit of work will first calculate the save queues, which weeds out entities which aren't changed and won't be saved anyway, so these don't have to be sent over the wire.
